Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
About Us
Founded in 1999 and listed on NASDAQ in 2003 and HKEX in 2021, Trip.com Group is a leading global travel service provider comprising of Trip.com, Ctrip, Skyscanner, and Qunar.

Across its platforms, Trip.com Group integrates travel resources from industry partners and helps travellers worldwide pursue the perfect trip with exceptional travel products and services.

We have four Customer Service Centres for Trip.com established in Japan, Korea, the UK, and the Philippines, providing 24/7 customer service in 19 different languages.

We have more than 30,000 employees scattered across 30 countries in Asia, Europe, the Americas, and Oceania, striving to expand our global markets and aiming to be the world’s leading and most trusted family of online travel brands that aspire to deliver the perfect trip at the best price for every traveller.

The Role:
As a Junior Data Analyst on our Partnerships and Affiliate Marketing team, you will play a critical role in supporting the success of our affiliate programs and partnerships. We are looking for someone who takes initiative, actively seeks out opportunities for improvement, and is eager to contribute to our team’s success.

In this Role, your responsibilities will include:

* Monitor and Analyze Performance: Track key performance indicators (KPIs) across various channels, identifying trends, and communicating to the team any anomalies, and opportunities for optimization.
* Generate Insights for Campaign Optimization: Assist in analyzing data to provide insights that help improve campaign performance, ROI, and overall marketing effectiveness.
* Develop and Maintain Dashboards: Contribute to the creation and maintenance of dashboards that provide real-time insights into program performance, making it easy for stakeholders to understand key metrics and trends.
* Support Partnership Strategies: Work with business developers and learn about the effectiveness of different partnerships, contributing data-driven recommendations for future collaborations.
* Take Initiative in Problem-Solving: Proactively identify issues or opportunities for optimization and develop strategies that improve overall performance.
* Collaborate Internationally: Work alongside marketing teams based in Shanghai and other global locations, ensuring that efforts align with broader marketing strategies and global business goals.
* Assist in Conducting Experiments: Support the design and analysis of experiments to test new strategies, creatives, or partnership models, contributing to data-driven decisions.

What you'll Need to Succeed:

* Strong Analytical Skills: Ability to interpret data, identify trends, and provide actionable insights.
* Communication Skills: Ability to translate data findings into clear, actionable insights for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Basic SQL Knowledge: Familiarity with SQL for querying and managing datasets is preferred, with a willingness to develop these skills further.
* Experience with Data Analysis Tools: Strong skills in Excel or Google Sheets, including functions, data manipulation, and pivot tables. Experience with tools like Python, R, or BigQuery is a plus, offering opportunities to engage in more complex data analysis and automation.
* Basic Data Visualization Experience: Familiarity with tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar for creating dashboards and visual reports, with opportunities to develop proficiency.
* Interest in Partnerships and Affiliates: A strong curiosity and willingness to learn about affiliate marketing and partnership strategies, and how different factors affect our KPIs.
* Proactive, Collaborative, and Solution-Oriented: A self-starter who takes initiative in identifying opportunities for improvement and optimization. You enjoy developing solutions and contributing to projects, while also working collaboratively with cross-functional teams across different regions to achieve shared goals.

Why Trip.com Group
We offer a stage to unleash your full potential and drive global impact. As an international team, we embrace an open and inclusive culture that supports and respect team members in and out of the workplace. Everyone is on a trip, whether it's a career trip or a life trip. At Trip.com Group, you can define your own trip by setting a goal and celebrate your success by recognizing the progress you have made.
What’s more?

* Our rapid business growth in global offers abundant career opportunities at various levels and in multiple functions

* Internal transfer is encouraged, and global job rotation program enable you to pursue a global career path and make global impact

* We provide learning opportunities to further your career in areas of leadership capability, soft skill and professional expertise.

* We encourage flexible work arrangement

* Have fun with company-sponsored greetings and activities at holidays, birthdays, and colorful team events.

Click[1] the link to learn more about What makes Trip.com Group a leading global travel service provider?

Click [2] the link to learn more about This is a Trip Where Both Your Career and Life Can Flourish!

Find out more job opportunities at https://careers.trip.com

Have a good trip, and see you soon!


References

Visible links
1. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w4D31J3atps
2. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KQSUxvFTyqM
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join Marveltest as a Data Analyst! 




About Us: At Marveltest, we’re at the forefront of data-driven business solutions. Our mission is to help businesses unlock the power of their data to drive growth and efficiency. As we continue to expand, we’re looking for a talented and motivated Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. If you’re passionate about data and love turning numbers into actionable insights, we want to hear from you!We’re looking for a Medior Data Analyst to join our team and help our clients reach the next digital level. You’ll be working with our Data Analysts, Growth Marketers, Client Managers, and Data-driven Designers to build data related products and services such as Data Warehousing and Pixel Tracking TechnologyYour Role: As a Medior Data Analyst at Marveltest, you’ll be a key player in transforming complex data into valuable business insights. Your responsibilities will include:




Data Warehousing: Manage data warehouses, focusing on data quality and validity.
Tableau Workbooks: Create and update Tableau dashboards, implementing changes based on internal and external requests.
Analytical Structures: Collaborate on designing modular and reusable analysis structures in Tableau.
Ad hoc Analyses: Conduct tailored analyses to answer business questions from both internal and external stakeholders.
Client Communication: Work closely with internal teams and clients to understand their data requirements and provide insights through dashboards and analyses.
Documentation: Maintain organized records of your analyses, ensuring they are accessible for future reference.




Collaboration within the Data Team: You’ll work closely with:

Business Analyst: Fine-tune business analyses to meet client needs.
Data Science/Engineering: Ensure seamless data flow from BigQuery to Tableau, troubleshoot issues, and improve data structure and quality.




Required Skillset:

Python: Proficient in using Python for data analysis and automation.
Excel: Comfortable with Excel, particularly for data manipulation and reporting.
Tableau (Advanced): 1+ years of experience with Tableau or a similar data visualization tool.
SQL: Strong SQL skills, with experience navigating Google BigQuery or other cloud data warehouses.
Business Acumen: Ability to connect data insights with business objectives, making recommendations that drive value.
Knowledge about online marketing metrics and business performance metrics.




Nice-to-Have Skills:

Data Simplification: Ability to explain complex analyses to non-data-savvy stakeholders.
Proactive Mindset: Eager to take initiative in a fast-paced startup environment.
Client Communication: Willingness to participate in client meetings and explain data insights clearly.




What do I get in return? 

Above market salary: we believe your superpowers should be well compensated.
A culture where growth, freedom, and innovation are key.
Working in an ambitious but close team: together we pull out all the stops when duty calls, but as it goes with superheroes, in real life we’re just a bunch of normal people who like to have a lot of fun together.
Help build the company: together we are always busy creating and testing new business frameworks, processes, and products.
The chance to be part of a fast-growing scale-up where you make a real impact on all clients.
The ability to work from our office in the center of Amsterdam, but also the flexibility to work from the comfort of your own home.
Bi-monthly team bonding events, weekly drinks, and daily get-togethers during (by Marveltest provided) lunch.
Your personal development is important! We have a personal budget for YOUR development.
An employee benefit to spend freely each month on a wide range of treats, powered by YourCampus.
26 paid holidays a year.
A MacBook Pro M-Chip laptop
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Want to get ahead of the game?




We are actively seeking top talent to join our team and help drive our company's success.




As a member of our Data Analyst Talent Community, you will have the opportunity to:




Be first in line to be considered for future job openings within the company

Network with other highly skilled professionals in your field

Stay up-to-date on the latest industry trends and developments

Receive exclusive content from Randstad industry leading teams




We are searching for Data Analyst professionals to join our industry leading organization in The Netherlands and other European Countries to experience what it's like to work in a truly Human Forward company that puts people first, offering flexible working setups and highly competitive compensation, whilst also giving you the chance to grow and develop your skills to build for your best future.




If you're interested in learning more about advancing your career then please click to apply to join our Talent Pool...




We are an inclusive employer and should you require any reasonable adjustments in order to

complete any aspect of the recruitment process, please contact the Internal Talent Acquisition (ITA) team.

Title: Data Analyst (Python)
Description:
Data Analyst (Python) – 2/3 Years of Experience

Full-time – Groningen, NL

Are you an experienced Data Analyst with a passion for Python and a keen interest in marketing, media, and technology? Do you thrive on turning complex data into actionable insights for some of the world’s most renowned brands? If you have 2-3 years of experience and are looking to take your career to the next level, we invite you to join our dynamic team at MeMo² (a Kantar Company).

About Us

At MeMo², we work with some of the biggest names in the industry—think Uber, Nike, Asics, Amazon, and more. Our team of young professionals is dedicated to delivering top-tier marketing and market research insights that help these global giants optimize their day-to-day marketing expenses and strategies. From our cozy office overlooking the canals in the heart of Groningen, we combine cutting-edge data analysis with a deep understanding of market dynamics to drive real results for our clients.

About the Role

As an experienced Data Analyst at MeMo², you’ll play a pivotal role in driving data-driven decisions by leading advanced data analysis projects. Your work will directly influence how major Dutch and international brands understand their market positioning and effectiveness. We’re looking for someone who not only excels in technical skills but also brings a proactive approach to problem-solving and innovation in data analytics.

Key Responsibilities

Lead Data Analysis: Conduct advanced data analyses using Python, leveraging our custom frameworks to deliver actionable insights.
Project Setup & Management: Take ownership of new projects, from conceptualization to execution, ensuring alignment with client objectives.
Client-Focused Insights: Provide major brands like Uber, Nike, and Amazon with deep insights that help optimize their marketing spend and strategy.
Data Visualization & Reporting: Create and enhance PowerBI dashboards, and present data in a clear, impactful way to internal and external stakeholders.
Automation & Pipeline Development: Develop and implement data automation processes using Python, Azure Functions, and other relevant tools to streamline operations.
Market Modeling & Insights: Apply advanced data analysis techniques, such as market modeling, to provide deep insights into market trends and media effectiveness.

Qualifications

Experience: 2-3 years of professional experience in data analysis with Python, including project management and client-facing roles.
Technical Proficiency: Strong experience with Python (pandas, NumPy, etc.), data automation (e.g., Azure Functions), and familiarity with data pipeline development.
Data Visualization: Experience with PowerBI or similar tools, with the ability to create and revamp dashboards for optimal use.
Educational Background: A degree in Consumer Psychology, Communication, Marketing/Media, Data Science, or a related field.
Communication Skills: Fluent in English or Dutch, with the ability to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Cultural Fit: A genuine interest in marketing, media, and technology, with the ability to thrive in a young, energetic team.

Why Join Us?

Exciting Projects: Work directly with some of the world’s largest and most influential brands, providing insights that drive global marketing strategies.
Vibrant Office Location: Work from our cozy office at a canal in the city center of Groningen, with a breathtaking view of the city’s landmarks.
Team Culture: Join a team of like-minded young professionals, with regular Friday afternoon drinks, office outings, and an extended lunch every day.
Growth Opportunities: Take on challenging projects and continuously develop your skills in a supportive, innovative environment.




Show more

Title: Data Analyst (Freelance)
Description:
As a Data Analyst, you will have the exciting opportunity to collaborate closely with our dynamic teams and working on multiple tasks. You will play an important role in creating engaging and insightful data visualizations using Tableau, using advanced data analysis and modelling techniques to find valuable trends and patterns within our datasets. Your involvement in developing and maintaining data models, reports, and workflows will be crucial to our success. Furthermore, you will actively engage with various business units, gaining a deep understanding of their unique needs and creating customized dashboards and solutions to meet and exceed their expectations.

About The Project

You should be already based in The Netherlands

Duration: 2-3 months

The Project Contains 2 Parts Of Development


The backend (data warehouse ) using the in-house data centre to develop a solution from data collocation to structured database (in storge ) ,
The frontend (visualisation ) : using the structured database in storge with the Tableau we cerate advance models flows in addition to build the dashboard visualizations.


What are the expectations/requirements?

You are already based in The Netherlands


Re-creation of existing dashboard and visualizations from PowerBI to tableau.
Creating data models from database using tableau Prep for visualizations
Creating new deep dives upon request
Interacting with multiple stakeholders to understand their requirements and implementing them in their dashboards
Gaid and support the stakeholders to understand and unlock the potential dashboard
Creating appealing dashboards and visualization, knowledge of UXUI would be nice


Key Responsibilities


Collaborate with the data solutions team to design, develop, and implement data-driven solutions
Create interactive and insightful data visualizations using Tableau
Perform complex data analysis and modelling to uncover trends, patterns, and insights using Tableau prep and SQL.
Assist in the development and maintenance of data pipelines and workflows
Discuss with business units (clients) to understand their needs and create dashboards tailored to their expectations
Contribute to the documentation of processes, methodologies, and best practices
Participate in team meetings, brainstorming sessions, and project planning activities


Want to know more about us?

We are serving the Swiss market as Switzerland’s leading IT & Telecom company. Thus, we are actively driving digitalization and networking, and tapping new paths for our customers and our employees. We do not know what the future is going to look like, but we definitely have the opportunity to shape it. To do so we are and act trustworthy, committed and curious.

Since 2019, we have been building up the coolest DevOps Center with a wonderful office at the World Trade Center in the heart of Rotterdam. We are currently recruiting IT passionate professionals who are keen on developing high-quality software, have an agile mindset and appreciate collaboration with motivated colleagues from all over the world.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
(Fulltime, 38hrs per week)

About The Job

Do you want to work for a highly successful, fast expanding international retailer with many growth opportunities? At Action we offer you the opportunity to become part of our newly created Strategy and Analytics team as Data Analyst and play an important role in supporting the overall growth of Action.

This is your daily action

The Data Analyst is part of the Business Development Team and reports to the Head of Business Development. Together with senior executives, the Strategy and Analytics team works on key topics for Action such as: Sustainability, Digitization, Expansion, Supply Chain and more. Together with your team members you support in driving data-driven decision-making across the organization.

Your work field is very dynamic, but in general involves tasks such as:


Build deep insights and analysis regarding the dynamic and competitive landscape in which we operate.
Work with our internal data and external market data to discover insights, converting these into tangible business recommendations that support our strategy.
Lead and participate in strategic projects, in close collaboration with your colleagues from the Strategy and Analytics Team and the Action team at large.
Support operational departments in root cause analyses and understanding performance issues


Your work location will be our International Head Office in Zwaagdijk (a 30 minutes traffic free drive from Amsterdam).

This is you

What you bring:


Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, R, and data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Familiarity with retail analytics, including sales forecasting, inventory, and customer behavior analysis.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in data analysis or a related field.
Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field.


What we offer

Surprisingly much! From our international headquarters in the Netherlands you have an impact on what happens in our stores across Europe. We welcome more than 15 million customers every week in more than 2,600 stores in 12 European countries. We have great growth ambitions. For Action and for you. Because our growth means that you can always take new steps. A different position, an interesting innovation project, new skills: you can continue to develop as a professional. And all this in a culture where our shared values are truly lived: customer focus, teamwork, simplicity, discipline, cost conscious and respect

Did you know that you can also count on us for:


A competitive salary based on a 38-hour working week
24 paid vacation days with the option of purchasing 5 extra days (based on 38 hours per week).
A temporary contract with the intention of offering you a permanent contract in the long term
Flexible working hours
15% employee discount on your purchases at Action
A good pension scheme and collective health insurance


How we contribute to society

If you only know Action from the stores, a world will open up for you when you come and work with us. We work hard to make a positive impact on society and the environment. Did you know, for example, that we sponsor more than 2,500 children worldwide who grow up in an SOS Children's Village? That our team reflects the diversity of our customers, including 155 different nationalities? That we purchase 94% of our wood products and 100% of our cotton sustainably? And that almost all our stores only use energy-efficient LED lighting? Yes, that is also Action. Curious about what other initiatives we’re facilitating? Join our team and find out for yourself.

Interested?

Take action and apply now!

The next steps


Our recruiter will review your application and get back to you as soon as possible.
We invite you for a first job interview.
We would like to get to know you better, which is why we ask you to take an online assessment.
We will invite you for a second interview and we will discuss your assessment.
Are we still a great match? Then we will become new colleagues!


At Action, integrity is of great importance to us. A pre-employment screening is therefore part of the application process for this vacancy. Contact your recruiter for more information.
Show more
HTML:
(Fulltime, 38hrs per week)

About The Job

Do you want to work for a highly successful, fast expanding international retailer with many growth opportunities? At Action we offer you the opportunity to become part of our newly created Strategy and Analytics team as Data Analyst and play an important role in supporting the overall growth of Action.

This is your daily action

The Data Analyst is part of the Business Development Team and reports to the Head of Business Development. Together with senior executives, the Strategy and Analytics team works on key topics for Action such as: Sustainability, Digitization, Expansion, Supply Chain and more. Together with your team members you support in driving data-driven decision-making across the organization.

Your work field is very dynamic, but in general involves tasks such as:

  • Build deep insights and analysis regarding the dynamic and competitive landscape in which we operate.
  • Work with our internal data and external market data to discover insights, converting these into tangible business recommendations that support our strategy.
  • Lead and participate in strategic projects, in close collaboration with your colleagues from the Strategy and Analytics Team and the Action team at large.
  • Support operational departments in root cause analyses and understanding performance issues

Your work location will be our International Head Office in Zwaagdijk (a 30 minutes traffic free drive from Amsterdam).

This is you

What you bring:

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
  • Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, R, and data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
  • Familiarity with retail analytics, including sales forecasting, inventory, and customer behavior analysis.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills.
  • Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in data analysis or a related field.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field.

What we offer

Surprisingly much! From our international headquarters in the Netherlands you have an impact on what happens in our stores across Europe. We welcome more than 15 million customers every week in more than 2,600 stores in 12 European countries. We have great growth ambitions. For Action and for you. Because our growth means that you can always take new steps. A different position, an interesting innovation project, new skills: you can continue to develop as a professional. And all this in a culture where our shared values are truly lived: customer focus, teamwork, simplicity, discipline, cost conscious and respect

Did you know that you can also count on us for:

  • A competitive salary based on a 38-hour working week
  • 24 paid vacation days with the option of purchasing 5 extra days (based on 38 hours per week).
  • A temporary contract with the intention of offering you a permanent contract in the long term
  • Flexible working hours
  • 15% employee discount on your purchases at Action
  • A good pension scheme and collective health insurance

How we contribute to society

If you only know Action from the stores, a world will open up for you when you come and work with us. We work hard to make a positive impact on society and the environment. Did you know, for example, that we sponsor more than 2,500 children worldwide who grow up in an SOS Children's Village? That our team reflects the diversity of our customers, including 155 different nationalities? That we purchase 94% of our wood products and 100% of our cotton sustainably? And that almost all our stores only use energy-efficient LED lighting? Yes, that is also Action. Curious about what other initiatives we’re facilitating? Join our team and find out for yourself.

Interested?

Take action and apply now!

The next steps

  • Our recruiter will review your application and get back to you as soon as possible.
  • We invite you for a first job interview.
  • We would like to get to know you better, which is why we ask you to take an online assessment.
  • We will invite you for a second interview and we will discuss your assessment.
  • Are we still a great match? Then we will become new colleagues!

At Action, integrity is of great importance to us. A pre-employment screening is therefore part of the application process for this vacancy. Contact your recruiter for more information.

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Data-analist




Ready to break boundaries in the analytical world? Accelerate your further Analytics engineering career with our advanced training program while working for our partner organization. We fully pay this program as well as your salary.




✅ Help a data driven team and their business by developing data-driven business solutions

✅ Working on the data modelling and creating relevant data sets and dashboard

✅ Build data pipelines to facilitate reporting

✅ Improving and automating data flows and processes




The role itself

· 2 fulltime weeks of hands-on bootcamp training where you’ll focus on writing deployable code, containerization, Analytics engineering & data engineering fundamentals

· Work 4 days a week as an Analytics engineer at one of our clients

· Join us every Wednesday at the Xccelerated office in Amsterdam. Here you will get ongoing training and project support from our technical leads

· At the end of your first year, you get the opportunity to join the partner organization directly




As an Analytics engineer you will work together with Data engineer & BI developers, whereby you will contribute on developing data-driven business solutions. You will do this in the form of machine learning models, strategic analyses and a self-service data model.

A big focus of your role will be data modelling and creating relevant data sets and dashboards. You will also be the one that transforms raw data to structured data files. To achieve this, you will build data pipelines to fully automate the availability of data for reporting.




About Xccelerated

Xccelerated is an initiative within the Xebia Group, accelerating growth of Data, Cloud & AI competence. Our 13-month advanced training programs integrate hands-on learning and skill development with working at one of our partner companies. It is an intense learning journey for who have proven their potential and are ready for the next step in their career.

Are you one of them? Join our dream team of 45 great people. Each member of our team brings a unique specialty and passion to our shared mission: eliminate the shortage of highly skilled Data & AI professionals. To achieve our goal, we empower each other to reach their full potential and inspire others to do the same.




This is you

From a personal perspective, you are customer focused and have a strong can-do mentality.

We are looking for a communicatively strong and enthusiastic colleague with a passion for data. Next to this, you have:

✅ A bachelor’s or master’s degree

✅ 1-4 years of work experience as an Analytics engineer/BI Developer/Data analyst

✅ Experience with data modelling, dashboarding and visualization (PowerBI)

✅ Experience with SQL; preferably also Python

✅ Experience with Cloud components




What Xccelerated offers




💰 Good salary

🛫 25 vacation days

📙 Kick off with 2 full-time weeks of hands-on bootcamp training

📊 Technical trainings & Innovation days for a full year (every week)

✅ Challenging assignments

💻 Macbook and Iphone

🍎 Lunches, amazing coffee and snack bar

🎒Flexibility in working from home & at the office

Interested? We’d love to meet you!




Please get in touch! Contact Jessie Loogman at jloogman@xccelerated.io or by phone at +31650999663.




Application Process

· First interview with one of our recruitment consultants

· Making a technical assessment (from home) you will present to one of or Tech Leads (home/on remote)

**We aim to complete an application process (from application to offer) within 1-3 weeks. As you will understand, this also depends on your own availability.

Title: Data Analyst – Advertising
Description:
How do you delight our customers?

Bol is always advancing its platform to create a better tomorrow for over 13 million customers and 49,000 trading partners. Our advertising propositions help shoppers discover products and advertisers reach customers – this is where you’ll make a difference. You’ll use data to help our advertising customers inform decisions, frame conversations, and change perceptions. And you’ll ensure it’s used effectively and responsibly.

The biggest challenge

Advertising via Bol is growing fast and is becoming an increasingly important channel for our advertising customers. Their need for data and insights are no exception. They rely on us to provide them with meaningful metrics, insightful analyses, and reliable predictive models to keep investing effectively

What You’ll Do As a Data Analyst

You’ll join 15 analysts in Bol’s advertising analytics organization. Together you share a mission of making people performant through analytics. This role is for the versatile analyst who is equally comfortable working with data as engaging with stakeholders. You’ll work with stakeholders to identify high value use cases for analytics, use SQL, Python, Dbt, and Tableau to then create metrics, do analysis across petabytes of data, make meaningful predictions, to eventually help advertising customers make better decisions. Your work will be input for amongst others client meetings, white papers, webinars, and public industry appearances.


You work closely with internal stakeholders (Sales, Customer Success, and Marketing) and top advertising and agency customers to identify high value applications of analytics.
You’re curious and develop deep domain knowledge to create meaningful language around our data and insights for our customers.
You prioritize, design, and perform analysis and/or dashboards.
You deliver insights and predictions through engaging dashboards and presentations.
You develop extensive domain knowledge to effectively manage and analyse advertising KPIs.
You write high quality and easily interpretable SQL and Python code that can be reused by colleagues and scales easily as data volumes increase.


3 reasons why this is (not) for you Switch to find out


If you strongly value clarity No, if innovating, autonomy, and ambiguity sound terrifying to you.
You only want to process data No, if you only want to process data and prefer someone else to handle project and stakeholder management.
If you believe analysts don’t need domain knowledge No, if you don't want to dive into the world of advertising. Curiosity and willingness to learn about our domain and customers are key to your success.
You’re an analytics professional Yes, if you have 5+ year experience delighting decision makers with your analytical skills. SQL is a must, Python scripting is a strong plus.
Obsess over building the right things Yes, if you believe output does not equal outcome and judge success by value creation.
You get (and create) energy by working with others Yes, if you can translate technical information into language anyone can understand. You enjoy working with both data and people.


It is our responsibility to enable an environment that unleashes the power of diversity.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Ben jij iemand die enthousiast wordt van data en graag klanten helpt bij het oplossen van complexe vraagstukken door middel van data-analyse? Wil je organisaties ondersteunen bij het begrijpen van hun historische gegevens en hen begeleiden in datagedreven besluitvorming? Als deze vragen je nieuwsgierig maken, dan is een rol als Senior Data Analist bij ons misschien wel iets voor jou!




Dit ga je doen als Senior Data Analist

Als Data Analist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het opleveren van analytics projecten, zowel zelfstandig als in teamverband met andere consultants. Afhankelijk van je ervaringsniveau, ben je verantwoordelijk voor het leiden van kleine teams van collega's tijdens de uitvoering. Tijdens een project maak je slim gebruik van de beschikbare data van de klant en vul je deze zo nodig aan met aanvullende data.

Je belangrijkste verantwoordelijkheden zijn:

Opleveren van analytics projecten in het descriptive en diagnostic analyse vakgebied
Ontwerpen en ontwikkelen van analytics benaderingen om de uitdagingen van de klant op te lossen
De behoeften van de klant signaleren en deze binnen de projectscope implementeren
Begeleiding en ondersteuning bieden aan de klant of je BearingPoint collega’s bij het implementeren van de uitkomsten van een analyse
Helpen bij het coachen en ontwikkelen van junior collega's in het D&A-team, ook buiten de context van een project
Hiaten identificeren in de data & analytics capaciteiten van de klant en deze proactief aanpakken, mogelijk als voorwaarden voor de voortgang van de oorspronkelijke analytics projecten.




Hier herken je jezelf in

Je hebt een afgeronde master in bijvoorbeeld Wiskunde, Natuurkunde, Econometrie, Operationele Research, Business Analytics, Data Science of een andere studie waar statistiek een belangrijk onderdeel was.
2-5 jaar ervaring als Data Analist, BI Expert of vergelijkbare rollen
Een proactieve en zelfstandige werkhouding
Kennis van en praktische ervaring met analytische technieken, waaronder maar niet beperkt tot data-analyse, data mining en datavisualisatie
Ervaring met business intelligence tools zoals PowerBi, QlikSense of Tableau
Ervaring met SQL of de bereidheid dit in de eerste maanden van je dienstverband te leren
Ervaring met Python of R is een pre
Ervaring in een consultancy rol is een pre
Uitstekende communicatievaardigheden in zowel het Nederlands als het Engels (schriftelijk en mondeling)




Dit bieden wij jou

Direct een vast contract
25 vakantiedagen
Leaseauto en NS-business card of mobiliteitsvergoeding
Laptop en smartphone
Collectief pensioen en zorgregeling
Flexibele werktijden

Een baan met impact

Werken op klantopdrachten met veel impact op de samenleving
Internationale, dynamische en inspirerende werkomgeving
Veel aandacht voor jouw professionele en persoonlijke groei
Getalenteerd en leuke collega’s om in multidisciplinaire teams mee samen te werken
Inhoudelijke activiteiten met collega’s binnen het D&A team zoals trainingen en kennissessies
Sociale activiteiten met collega’s, zoals maandelijkse borrels, teamuitjes en wintersport




Heb je interesse? Laat dan je cv en contact gegevens hier achter, dan nemen wij graag zo snel mogelijk contact met je op. Wij streven ernaar een werkomgeving te creëren waar iedereen helemaal zichzelf kan zijn en het beste uit zichzelf kan halen. Met ruimte voor ondernemerschap, persoonlijke ambities en creativiteit. Wij zetten ons in voor gelijke kansen, diversiteit en inclusie.




Together, we are more than business. www.bearingpointcareers.nl

Show more

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
As Business/Information Analyst for Measurement Data Management (MDM) you will ensure that various sets of vehicle usage data are collected from the truck remotely ‘over the air’ in a backend IoT application, from where the data will be distributed to consuming applications for a vast range of business services and business purposes. In order to manage the Measurement Data you will be configuring how the data is collected from the vehicle CAN bus and by a telematics connectivity device (TCU) sent to the backend.




The MDM Business Analyst will work in the ‘Measurement Data Management Team’ (MDM team) of the PACCAR Global Connected Services department. This team follows the scrum framework and works in 2-week sprints delivering measurement configurations that have been designed, developed and tested according to requirements. The MDM team also defines and documents their business processes and Way of Working, ensuring that all designs and data configurations are dealt with and documented properly.




Personality and competences:

an analyst through and through, enjoying analyzing business and IT issues, processes and information,

accessible and good communication skills to find and align with involved stakeholders (and they can easily find and approach you),

be assertive, dare to take the initiative

be able to define business and functional requirements based on input from stakeholders

be able to write design documentation

be able to backwards define requirements when not formally received/documented

be able to work in a ‘dynamic’ and innovative environment, stress-resilient

be able to quickly show results to product owner with little handover

be able to work 2-3 days a week on site in Eindhoven

good knowledge of English as working language, Dutch is a pre

preferred to be able to communicate with multiple nationalities over different time zones




Experience and knowledge:

experience in writing requirements and design documents

general ICE and BEV automotive knowledge and basic understanding of functional vehicle behavior

working knowledge of CAN networks, e.g. dbc-files, can-interfaces, hex and binary calculations

understanding of automotive standards such as SAE J1939 and (r)FMS

general understanding of data streaming

knowledge of high-frequency data transmission concepts such as RabbitMQ, Confluent, Apache Kafka

experience in Agile environments and working in scrum teams

pre: experience with validating/testing embedded software

pre: experience with data analysis/validation (validation of large amounts of data)




Skills:

Azure DevOps

Snowflake/SQL

JSON + REST APIs

Pre: Python (generic scripting, robot framework, flask, pandas)

pre: MicroFocus ALM

Title: Data analyst
Description:
As a Data Analyst at Newcraft you’ll delve into the data of our A-brand clients in order to improve their channel conversions. You’re a crucial link in the digital acceleration of our top brand clients.

What You’ll Be Working On

Together with your fellow Commerce team members, you will make sure our clients achieve digital growth. You will collect and analyze quantitative and qualitative data to discover opportunities that improve the online customer journey. In this process, you collaborate closely with the client to ensure that your knowledge and skills are effectively transferred.

Your Responsibilities


Collect, plan and execute data driven online optimization programs.
Initiate hypothesis-driven A/B tests with the aim of improving visitor to buyer conversion.
Translate data into comprehensible visualizations using Google Analytics, Tableau or a similar program.
Advise and convince teams at every level.
Create and guide implementation of measurement plans for both web and app.
Involving various teams in your optimization plans, regardless of their level of digital maturity.


Qualifications


A background of 1-3 years in analytics in a commercial online setting.
Proficiency in SQL, BigQuery, Python, or R, and a strong inclination toward these technologies.
Familiarity with the Google Marketing Platform, including GA4, Google Tag Manager, and Looker Studio is beneficial.
Bonus points for experience in A/B testing and familiarity with customer feedback tools like Optimizely, VWO, Hotjar, or Usabilla.
If you know your way around visualisation tools like PowerBI or Tableau, that would make you a superstar.


Who You Are


Proactive, analytical and eager to learn.
Self-starting.
Good communication skills; you can translate complex data into a comprehensive story.
Fluent in Dutch and English.


About Us

At Newcraft, you will be working in a stimulating environment where you can collaborate with colleagues to improve and optimize client campaigns. We encourage continuous growth and development and expect you to stay up-to-date with the latest developments in the email marketing world.

Together, you’ll make a difference, and enjoyment is an integral part of the job. We’re passionate about what we do, about each other, and for whom we work.
Show more
HTML:
As a Data Analyst at Newcraft you’ll delve into the data of our A-brand clients in order to improve their channel conversions. You’re a crucial link in the digital acceleration of our top brand clients.

What You’ll Be Working On

Together with your fellow Commerce team members, you will make sure our clients achieve digital growth. You will collect and analyze quantitative and qualitative data to discover opportunities that improve the online customer journey. In this process, you collaborate closely with the client to ensure that your knowledge and skills are effectively transferred.

Your Responsibilities

  • Collect, plan and execute data driven online optimization programs.
  • Initiate hypothesis-driven A/B tests with the aim of improving visitor to buyer conversion.
  • Translate data into comprehensible visualizations using Google Analytics, Tableau or a similar program.
  • Advise and convince teams at every level.
  • Create and guide implementation of measurement plans for both web and app.
  • Involving various teams in your optimization plans, regardless of their level of digital maturity.

Qualifications

  • A background of 1-3 years in analytics in a commercial online setting.
  • Proficiency in SQL, BigQuery, Python, or R, and a strong inclination toward these technologies.
  • Familiarity with the Google Marketing Platform, including GA4, Google Tag Manager, and Looker Studio is beneficial.
  • Bonus points for experience in A/B testing and familiarity with customer feedback tools like Optimizely, VWO, Hotjar, or Usabilla.
  • If you know your way around visualisation tools like PowerBI or Tableau, that would make you a superstar.

Who You Are

  • Proactive, analytical and eager to learn.
  • Self-starting.
  • Good communication skills; you can translate complex data into a comprehensive story.
  • Fluent in Dutch and English.

About Us

At Newcraft, you will be working in a stimulating environment where you can collaborate with colleagues to improve and optimize client campaigns. We encourage continuous growth and development and expect you to stay up-to-date with the latest developments in the email marketing world.

Together, you’ll make a difference, and enjoyment is an integral part of the job. We’re passionate about what we do, about each other, and for whom we work.

Title: BI Consultant
Description:
Randstad – Tot €6500 per maand – Hybride werken, tot 50% vanuit huis

De vrijheid om je week zelf in te delen en tot 50% vanuit huis te werken. Een warm team consultants, kennissessies en wekelijks een gezamenlijke lunch in ons prachtige kantoor in Zeist. Daarnaast een jaarlijks opleidingsbudget van €5000 voor jouw persoonlijke en professionele groei. Ons diverse team van data specialisten werkt aan uitdagende projecten voor uiteenlopende klanten. Interesse? Lees verder en ontdek hoe jij Adapt Analytics kunt versterken!




Wat jij gaat doen:

Als BI Specialist bij Adapt Analytics speel je een cruciale rol in het helpen van onze klanten om hun data optimaal te benutten. Je werkt aan uiteenlopende opdrachten bij onze klanten. Dit zijn vaak MKB-bedrijven of gemeenten, maar ook bij grote organisaties zoals Schiphol en de ING bank. Jouw werkzaamheden omvatten:

Data modelleren en analyseren om bedrijfsprocessen te verbeteren en waardevolle inzichten te genereren.
Schrijven van complexe queries in SQL en werken met tools zoals Azure Data Factory en PowerBI.
Adviseren van klanten over datastrategieën en het ophalen van requirements bij stakeholders.
Implementeren van data gedreven oplossingen en samenwerken in agile/scrum teams.




Waar je terecht komt:

Adapt Analytics helpt organisaties om data-gedreven te werken. Onze missie is om de behoeften van onze klanten concreet te maken en hen te ondersteunen in hun data-ambities. We zijn ambitieus en volop in groei, dit zorgt voor veel interne doorgroeimogelijkheden.

Wij hechten veel waarde aan een inclusieve cultuur waarin iedereen zich welkom voelt. Onze cultuur is uniek, ontspannen en gebaseerd op vertrouwen. Ons kantoor in Zeist is een inspirerende werkplek waar we wekelijks gezamenlijke lunches organiseren en waar regelmatig sociale en kennisactiviteiten plaatsvinden. Zo creëren we een omgeving waar binding, collegialiteit hoof in het vaandel staan. Wij geloven in een leven lang leren, daarom faciliteren wij jaarlijks een opleidingsbudget van €5000 voor jouw persoonlijke en professionele groei.




Wie jij bent:

Je hebt minimaal een Hbo-opleiding afgerond.
Je hebt werkervaring met SQL, data modeling en data visualisatietools zoals PowerBI, Tableau of Qlik.
Je beheerst zowel het Nederlands als het Engels uitstekend.
Je bent proactief, overtuigend en een goede gesprekspartner.




Wat wij bieden:

Direct een vast dienstverband.
Verdien tot €6500,- bruto per maand excl. 8% vakantietoeslag.
Een ruim opleidingsbudget van €5000 per jaar o.b.v. fulltime om jezelf doorlopend te ontwikkelen.
Een elektrische auto van de zaak (bijvoorbeeld een Tesla Model 3) of een alternatieve mobiliteitsvergoeding.
€500 bruto per jaar voor de inrichting van je thuiswerkplek.
Ontvang een percentage over je behaalde omzet.
26 vakantiedagen o.b.v. fulltime + 1 extra dag voor je verjaardag (óók als die in het weekend valt).
Werk 2 tot 3 dagen per week vanuit huis, afhankelijk van jouw lopende opdracht.
Premievrije pensioenregeling.
Een prachtig kantoor in Zeist met wekelijks gezamenlijke lunches en diverse sociale en kennisactiviteiten.
Een cultuur van vrijheid en verantwoordelijkheid, waarin je de ruimte krijgt om je eigen ideeën te realiseren en te groeien in je rol.




Hoe nu verder:

Ben jij de BI Consultant die we zoeken? Heb je een passie voor data en wil je deel uitmaken van een dynamisch en divers team? Stuur je CV en motivatiebrief naar anne@adapt.nl en word onderdeel van Adapt analytics! Voor vragen over deze vacature kun je contact opnemen met Anne, onze recruiter, via 06 1613 6164 of per mail. Tot snel!

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Wie is LEF?

Wij zijn dé plek waar IT-professionals de kans krijgen om te innoveren en te werken aan de toekomst. De core-business van LEF is het ondersteunen van opdrachtgevers bij innovatieve vraagstukken op het gebied van IT. Wij zijn geen doorsnee IT-detacheerder. Nee, bij ons onderneem je mee, ontwikkel je mee en verdien je mee. Naast de uitdagende opdrachten heb je bij LEF namelijk de mogelijkheid om mee te bouwen aan de organisatie, door bijvoorbeeld mee te denken over het inrichten van ons talent management of het uitrollen van nieuwe diensten.




Wie zoeken wij?

Heb jij een passie voor data en wil je bijdragen aan het nemen van strategische beslissingen? Als Data Analist speel je een essentiële rol in een team van onze opdrachtgevers, waar je de kans krijgt om complexe datasets te doorgronden en waardevolle inzichten te genereren. Deze functie biedt jou de mogelijkheid om jouw analytische vaardigheden toe te passen en een impact te hebben op de koers van die organisaties.




Over de werkzaamheden:

Als Data Analist ben je verantwoordelijk voor:




Verzamelen, transformeren en opschonen van gegevens uit diverse bronnen om analyses mogelijk te maken;
Analyseren van datasets om trends en patronen te ontdekken en interpreteren van resultaten om datagestuurde aanbevelingen te doen;
Ontwikkelen en onderhouden van rapportages en dashboards om gegevens visueel te presenteren;
Samenwerken met verschillende teams zoals marketing, sales en productontwikkeling om databehoeften te begrijpen en te vertalen naar bruikbare inzichten;
Monitoren van datakwaliteit en zorgen voor nauwkeurigheid en consistentie van gegevens.




Wat maakt ons een fijne werkgever?

Wij bieden niet alleen een uitdagende en verantwoordelijke functie, maar ook:




Een dynamische werkomgeving waarin innovatie wordt aangemoedigd;
Mogelijkheden voor professionele en persoonlijk ontwikkeling en groei;
Je wordt onderdeel van een community, waar een teamgerichte cultuur heerst met ruimte voor eigen initiatief;
En wij de bieden de mogelijkheid om je mee te laten bouwen aan onze organisatie. Denk bijvoorbeeld mee over het inrichten van ons Talent Management of het uitrollen van nieuwe diensten.




Arbeidsvoorwaarden:

Bij LEF heb jij de regie over je eigen carrière en wij begrijpen dat iedereen unieke behoeften heeft. Daarom kan je gebruik maken van ons flexibel employee benefits programma, zodat je zelf kunt kiezen welke arbeidsvoorwaarden het beste bij jou passen. Kies je voor de standaard:




Bruto maandsalaris van €3.500 tot €7.500. Inclusief bonussen tot €120.000 op jaarbasis
Riante bonussen en winstuitkering
25 vakantiedagen
8% vakantiegeld
Een goede pensioenregeling
Auto van de zaak
Laptop van de zaak
Direct een vast contract




Of heb je liever:




Bruto maandsalaris van €3.500 tot €7.500. Inclusief bonussen tot €120.000 op jaarbasis
Riante bonussen en winstuitkering
30 vakantiedagen
10% vakantiegeld
Een goede pensioenregeling
Een fiets van de zaak
Een laptop van de zaak
Een sportabonnement
Direct een vast contract




Dan is dat ook zeker mogelijk.




Functie-eisen:

Een afgeronde opleiding op hbo-niveau of hoger, bij voorkeur in een technische richting;
Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring als Data Analist;
Ervaring met SQL;
Ervaring met data visualisatietools zoals Power BI;
Ervaring met programmeertalen zoals Python of R is een pré;
Sterke analytische en een ondernemende instelling;
Vloeiende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk.

Title: Traineeship Data Analist
Description:
Traineeship Data Analist - Marktleider op het gebied van superfoods




Wil jij werken bij een snelgroeiend bedrijf in een (inter)nationale omgeving met een omzet van 330 miljoen en 547 werknemers wereldwijd? Vanwege hun groei breiden zij hun team uit en zoeken ze toppers die interesse hebben om zich verder te ontwikkelen binnen Data. Zoek jij een werkgever waar je optimaal jezelf wil kan ontwikkelen tot een volwaardige Data Analist? Lees dan zeker verder!




Ze houden zich bezig met de import, distributie, bewerking en verpakking van noten, superfoods, zaden en gedroogd fruit. Ze richten zich sterk op innovatie, kwaliteit, betrouwbaarheid en aanwezigheid in de oorsprongslanden. Door hun actieve (internationale) aanwezigheid in de gehele voedsel waardeketen, van boer tot bord, zijn zij uitstekend gepositioneerd om bij te dragen aan een betere wereld.




Wat ga je doen?

Verzamelen, structureren en controleren van data. Altijd met het doel: hoe kunnen we daar nog meer impact mee maken.
Verder helpen van onze organisatie, door nog slimmer, beter, sneller of gewoon anders data te benutten of te combineren.
Ontwikkelen van datamodellen en bijdragen aan datavisualisatie (lijkt moeilijk, maar met de juiste begeleiding is het een peace of cake).
Schrijven van rapportages waarin je de bevindingen uit je onderzoek opneemt.
Onderzoeken en stroomlijnen van diverse processen.
Geven van advies aan senior management, jouw werk maakt verschil en doet er echt toe.




Wie ben jij en wat neem je mee?

Je bent iemand die zoek is naar een uitdagende en veelzijdige functie in een internationale omgeving. Je bent leergierig, ambitieus en zoekt altijd naar verbeteringen die je ook omzet in acties. Je krijgt energie van Data, welcome growth!




Jij hebt:

Minimaal HBO werk- en denkniveau, met een Finance & Control, Computer Science of een vergelijkbare studie. Je affiniteit met Data is belangrijker!
Een sterke drang om je te ontwikkelen.
Sterke analytische vaardigheden.
Een proactieve en gedreven manier van werken om iedere dag waarde toe te voegen.




Wat hebben zij jou te bieden?

Gedurende je traineeship kan je een salaris verwachten tussen de 3100 en 3300 euro per maand.
Een uitdagende baan met veel leer- en doorgroeimogelijkheden.
Je gaat je ontwikkelen tot een volwaardige Data Analist.
Een ambitieuze organisatie waar veel interessante trajecten lopen en waar jij kan bijdragen.




Voor meer informatie betreffende deze positie, neem contact op met Zaker Sidiki via 0653202595 of via zaker@fintalent.nl

Show more

Title: Data Analyst – Adobe Analytics & Launch
Description:
ABOUT US

We are a fast-growing, close-knit, dynamic, and successful Digital Services Company that specializes in providing support to large multinational companies for SEO, Product & Web Content Management, Social Media Management, Performance Marketing, E-Commerce Management, CRM & E-Mail Marketing Automation, DX & Development, Data Management & Analytics, Project Management, Digital Consultancy, and Recruitment.




As a multinational Dutch company, we have offices in Amsterdam, Istanbul, Lisbon, Kuala Lumpur, Bogota & Portland. With our exceptionally talented & diverse team, and our A+ client portfolio, the world is our oyster!




We are currently looking for an Data Analyst – Adobe Analytics Developer to join our team.




RESPONSIBILITIES

Lead the setup, management, and optimization of Adobe Analytics properties, ensuring accurate data collection and reporting.
Develop and manage tagging strategies using Adobe Launch, including server-side tagging, Adobe Direct Calls, DataLayers and advanced configuration.
Troubleshoot and resolve complex data collection and reporting issues, ensuring data accuracy across all analytics platforms.
Conduct detailed data analysis and provide actionable insights to enhance user engagement, conversion rates, and feature development.
Collaborate with marketing, product, and development teams to define and refine key metrics and KPIs.
Develop and implement data processes and documentation, ensuring effective self-service data frameworks.
Ensure compliance with data regulations in project implementations, with a focus on secure data management.
Collaborate with IT for advanced BI tool integration and conduct specialized end-user training.
Evaluate and implement new analytics technologies and methodologies, staying current with industry trends.
Implementation: Lead Adobe Analytics tracking for native and hybrid mobile apps, ensuring accurate data collection through SDKs and Adobe Launch.
Framework-Specific Tracking: Implement tracking for apps built with frameworks like React Native and Vue Native.
Edge Network Integration: Utilize Adobe Edge Network for real-time analytics and personalization.




QUALIFICATIONS

Education:

Bachelor’s degree in economics, econometrics, statistics, computer science, or a related field; Master’s degree is a plus.

Technical Skills:

Proficient in analytics platforms, particularly Adobe Analytics, with experience in administration and advanced configuration.
Expertise in tag management tools, specifically Adobe Launch, including custom tag implementation and debugging.
Strong skills in JavaScript and its frameworks, with practical experience using ChromeDev Tools for troubleshooting.
Advanced knowledge of data cloud platforms and their integration with web analytics tools.
Experience in managing and optimizing MarTech and AdOps platforms.
Intermediate understanding of data compliance regulations (GDPR, CCPA) and their application in digital analytics.

Analytical Skills:

Advanced analytical skills for resolving complex data issues and providing strategic insights.

Compliance Knowledge:

In-depth understanding of data compliance regulations and their practical application in projects.

Leadership:

Experience in leading smaller projects or components of larger projects, with the ability to mentor junior team members.

Collaboration:

Effective communication and collaboration with cross-functional teams.

Continuous Learning:

Demonstrated interest in advancing knowledge and skills in data analytics and emerging technologies.

Mobile SDK Expertise:

Proficient in Adobe Experience Platform Mobile SDKs for iOS and Android, including custom event tracking and user segmentation for both native and cross-platform apps (React Native, Vue Native, etc.). Skilled in Adobe Launch for mobile apps, including server-side tagging and dataLayer management.

Edge Network & Integration:

Experience with Adobe Edge Network for real-time data collection and integration with other Adobe Experience Cloud services.




WHAT WE OFFER

Remote Work Model💻: We enhance flexibility, foster productivity, and facilitate a healthier work-life balance for our employees!

Birthday Time Off🎂: A half-day off is granted on birthdays.

Mental Health & Support💆🏻‍♀️: Free company subscription to our mental health & support partner ‘’Openup’’.

Referral Program👫🏻: Our referral program ‘’Friends2Work’’ encourages our employees to refer their friends followed by a cash award once they are hired.

Self-Improvement💪🏻: Access to numerous online courses and training in our own in-house training platform NMQ Academy & access to our exclusive Mentorship Program provided by our brilliant senior peers.

Team Environment👑: We give you to opportunity to work with global brands together with a fun, diverse, and dynamic team and become a part of a global success story!




If you are interested in joining our team, please apply with your CV in English.




By applying to this job advertisement, you accept that you have shared your personal data within the scope of the clarification text we have provided at www.nmqdigital.com




NMQ Digital is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.




Don't be discouraged if you feel that you don’t fully meet every single one of the requirements for a particular role, there is always room for growth in NMQ!

HTML:
ABOUT US

We are a fast-growing, close-knit, dynamic, and successful Digital Services Company that specializes in providing support to large multinational companies for SEO, Product & Web Content Management, Social Media Management, Performance Marketing, E-Commerce Management, CRM & E-Mail Marketing Automation, DX & Development, Data Management & Analytics, Project Management, Digital Consultancy, and Recruitment.


As a multinational Dutch company, we have offices in Amsterdam, Istanbul, Lisbon, Kuala Lumpur, Bogota & Portland. With our exceptionally talented & diverse team, and our A+ client portfolio, the world is our oyster!


We are currently looking for an Data Analyst – Adobe Analytics Developer to join our team.


RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Lead the setup, management, and optimization of Adobe Analytics properties, ensuring accurate data collection and reporting.
  • Develop and manage tagging strategies using Adobe Launch, including server-side tagging, Adobe Direct Calls, DataLayers and advanced configuration.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve complex data collection and reporting issues, ensuring data accuracy across all analytics platforms.
  • Conduct detailed data analysis and provide actionable insights to enhance user engagement, conversion rates, and feature development.
  • Collaborate with marketing, product, and development teams to define and refine key metrics and KPIs.
  • Develop and implement data processes and documentation, ensuring effective self-service data frameworks.
  • Ensure compliance with data regulations in project implementations, with a focus on secure data management.
  • Collaborate with IT for advanced BI tool integration and conduct specialized end-user training.
  • Evaluate and implement new analytics technologies and methodologies, staying current with industry trends.
  • Implementation: Lead Adobe Analytics tracking for native and hybrid mobile apps, ensuring accurate data collection through SDKs and Adobe Launch.
  • Framework-Specific Tracking: Implement tracking for apps built with frameworks like React Native and Vue Native.
  • Edge Network Integration: Utilize Adobe Edge Network for real-time analytics and personalization.


QUALIFICATIONS

Education:

  • Bachelor’s degree in economics, econometrics, statistics, computer science, or a related field; Master’s degree is a plus.

Technical Skills:

  • Proficient in analytics platforms, particularly Adobe Analytics, with experience in administration and advanced configuration.
  • Expertise in tag management tools, specifically Adobe Launch, including custom tag implementation and debugging.
  • Strong skills in JavaScript and its frameworks, with practical experience using ChromeDev Tools for troubleshooting.
  • Advanced knowledge of data cloud platforms and their integration with web analytics tools.
  • Experience in managing and optimizing MarTech and AdOps platforms.
  • Intermediate understanding of data compliance regulations (GDPR, CCPA) and their application in digital analytics.

Analytical Skills:

  • Advanced analytical skills for resolving complex data issues and providing strategic insights.

Compliance Knowledge:

  • In-depth understanding of data compliance regulations and their practical application in projects.

Leadership:

  • Experience in leading smaller projects or components of larger projects, with the ability to mentor junior team members.

Collaboration:

  • Effective communication and collaboration with cross-functional teams.

Continuous Learning:

  • Demonstrated interest in advancing knowledge and skills in data analytics and emerging technologies.

Mobile SDK Expertise:

  • Proficient in Adobe Experience Platform Mobile SDKs for iOS and Android, including custom event tracking and user segmentation for both native and cross-platform apps (React Native, Vue Native, etc.). Skilled in Adobe Launch for mobile apps, including server-side tagging and dataLayer management.

Edge Network & Integration:

  • Experience with Adobe Edge Network for real-time data collection and integration with other Adobe Experience Cloud services.


WHAT WE OFFER

Remote Work Model💻: We enhance flexibility, foster productivity, and facilitate a healthier work-life balance for our employees!

Birthday Time Off🎂: A half-day off is granted on birthdays.

Mental Health & Support💆🏻‍♀️: Free company subscription to our mental health & support partner ‘’Openup’’.

Referral Program👫🏻: Our referral program ‘’Friends2Work’’ encourages our employees to refer their friends followed by a cash award once they are hired.

Self-Improvement💪🏻: Access to numerous online courses and training in our own in-house training platform NMQ Academy & access to our exclusive Mentorship Program provided by our brilliant senior peers.

Team Environment👑: We give you to opportunity to work with global brands together with a fun, diverse, and dynamic team and become a part of a global success story!


If you are interested in joining our team, please apply with your CV in English.

Title: ABN AMRO Traineeship - Data Analyst
HTML:
At a glance

As a data analyst trainee you will learn how to sift through data and seek to identify trends. What stories do the numbers tell? What business decisions can be made based on these insights? See yourself as a consultant between the data and a business line. As a data analyst you may also create visual representations, such as dashboards, charts and graphs to better showcase what the data reveals. With this Traineeship you will take the first step in your career as a data analyst to develop yourself personally and professionally!

Your job

  • Conduct consumer/business data research and analytics;
  • Extract actionable insights from large databases;
  • Perform recurring and ad hoc quantitative analysis to support day-to-day decision making;
  • Support reporting and analytics, such as KPIs, financial reports, and creating and improving dashboards;
  • Help translate data into visualizations, metrics, and goals.


Your profile

As a data analyst trainee you should have a degree in mathematics, statistics, physics, econometrics or business, with an analytics focus. You must have strong skills in math, science, programming, databases, modelling, and predictive analytics.

Who are you?

  • Entrepreneurial spirit, creative mind-set and capable of assessing and evaluating risks;
  • Knowledge of or at least interested in technology and how this supports business improvements;
  • Thrives in an international context;
  • Thinks in terms of what’s possible, sees opportunities and takes a solutions-oriented approach;
  • Self-starter who readily assumes responsibility;
  • You have a valid EU work permit.


What’s your experience?

  • Experience working with R or Python;
  • Experience working with SQL;
  • A strong combination of analytical skills, intellectual curiosity, and reporting skills;
  • Experience visualizing and presenting data, e.g. PowerBI;
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills;
  • A proactive approach, with an ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously;
  • No more than 2 years of work experience (internships do not count as work experience), this is a graduate programme.


Nice to have:

  • A basic understanding of cloud technology;
  • A basic understanding of data mining techniques, emerging technologies (MapReduce, Spark, large-scale data frameworks, machine learning, neural networks);
  • Familiarity with the Agile methodology.


What We Offer

In our Data Traineeship, we prepare you to become a Data Expert who is not only relevant today but also prepared for the challenges of tomorrow and beyond. This program offers a balanced blend of professional and personal development training. Our commitment to your growth extends beyond the traineeship, as we continue to invest in your long-term career and provide guidance throughout your journey within the bank.

Moreover, our Data Strategy at ABN AMRO is focused on harnessing the power of data to drive insightful decision-making, enhance customer experiences, and maintain our competitive edge in the market. By integrating this strategy into our traineeship, we ensure that you not only gain practical skills but also understand the strategic importance of data in driving business success.

We are currently designing an entirely new program, so we can’t provide detailed specifics just yet. However, there’s no need to worry—exciting themes abound! Imagine engaging in enriching training sessions and masterclasses on cutting-edge topics like AI and Sustainability, as well as Leadership. You’ll be supported by a coach and mentor to ensure you receive the guidance you need.

What’s more, you won’t be confined to just one department within the bank. We want you to experience the breadth of our organization, which is why you’ll participate in multiple project rotations. This dynamic approach will allow you to gain a comprehensive understanding of our bank and develop a diverse skill set. Get ready for a journey filled with opportunities for growth, learning, and making meaningful contributions!

Interested?

Are you interested? Apply via the button above and upload your resume and cover letter. Do not apply for more than one position within the Data Traineeship, so choose between the Data Analyst and Data Scientist position. We are looking for graduates with a strong motivation to work for ABN AMRO. The Data Traineeship program starts in January 2025, it is possible to start working earlier with your team before the courses start in order to become acquainted with your new environment.

Selection process

After you apply you will receive an e-mail within 10 working days to let you know if you have been selected and can move forward to the next round. The overall recruitment process includes:

  • Apply online with your CV and cover letter;
  • CV screening by recruitment;
  • Online capacity test;
  • CV screening by hiring manager;
  • Online interview and case presentation by candidate;
  • Second interview;
  • Job offer.


If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us at werkenbij@nl.abnamro.com.

Equal opportunities for all

The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.

Disclaimer external recruitment agencies

External recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. In addition, a recruitment agency can only submit a resume when invited by a Talent Acquisition Specialist to join the search for a right candidate. All unsolicited resumes sent to us will be considered property of ABN AMRO BANK N.V. In this case, ABN AMRO will not be held liable to pay a placement fee.

Wij bieden

  • Een leergierige houding
  • Analytische skills

Title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Join the strategic marketing team, a highly transversal team interacting with various stakeholders within Orange Business: Strategy, Business Lines, Strategic Value Propositions (SVP) Leaders, Zones, Finance etc.




About the role




The team’s main ambitions are:

To lead and/or contribute to understanding our markets, our competition, and the evolution of our customer's expectations to analyze our key challenges and opportunities
To measure our customers’ satisfaction (NPS), analyze results, and provide recommendations for action plans driving their improvement
To construct our marketing plan, providing a 2-year compass for our execution plans
To analyze our products & services portfolio and consolidate our roadmaps across Orange Business, to optimize our commercial catalog
To provide guidance on the products & services development process and support the transformation of our ways of working towards more agile methodologies
To enable the monitoring of our performance through a unique tool developed for value management across Orange Business




The position we’re looking for will be part of the Strategic Marketing plan team, which is responsible for the first 3 pillars of the above (market understanding, voice of customers & marketing plan).




Missions




Strategic & Customer Marketing of Orange Business is recruiting a Senior Marketing Data Analyst.

The position reports to the Director of Strategic Marketing plan.

The Senior Marketing Data Analyst is a key asset to foster data-driven analysis and Go-to-Market strategies, in line with the strategy and business priorities of Orange Business.




Main activities are:




Co-lead a project called market referential, that has recently been kicked off. The project is owned by both Strategy & Strategic Marketing teams. Its ambition is to create a single market data referential to feed the development of strategic plan, marketing plan, and Zone GTM plans. The project involves defining the sources of truth for market sizing & market growth on our scopes of activities in our addressable markets per Zone. The projects embeds both alignment on key data sources between strategy, business lines and zones and tooling development to make it available across the company
Coordinate our annual French survey (Novascope) with the channels (DEF DGC) and Business Lines
Analyze our current positioning & potential gaps or opportunities for growth (with a specific focus on our strategic priorities such as strategic value propositions)
Leverage data to propose segmentation criteria on our strategic priorities: which target audience, which vertical, for which purpose, with which offer…
Liaise with SVP leaders, Business Lines & zones to ensure we have trajectories that are consistent with the market and our ambitions
Feed our marketing plan with key recommendations for action plans: target audiences to address, offers to develop, communication to be done…
Lead analysts’ contracts negotiation & manage associated budget




The role is global, addressing all of our market segments (Orange Business France and International + Direction Enterprises (France) and requires interactions with a wide range of stakeholders from several entities (Products & Marketing, Zones, Finance, HR, Strategy…)




About you:




Advanced degree (Master's or MBA) in Business, Marketing, Economics, Finance or Computer Science
10+ years of professional experience in market research or strategy, data analysis, or market insights roles
Strong analytical skills with a data-driven mindset, leveraging primary and syndicated research, market and competitive analysis to inform strategic decision
Proficient in developing data reporting infrastructures and producing insightful reports for senior stakeholders to support decision-making
Extensive hands-on experience with data analysis techniques, including ETL processes, data modeling/management, and data visualization
In-depth knowledge of data analytical tools, techniques, and languages such as SQL, Power BI/Tableau, Knime/Dataiku/Alteryx, SSAS
Ability to give meaning, and understanding of the strategy and challenges of its entity
Team spirit, transversality, coordination, and lead of stakeholders around a project, even remotely
Results-oriented related to business objectives
Leadership, ability to convince, great interpersonal skills, listening
Strong project management skills
Autonomy and ability to quickly adapt to organizational changes, to react and find quick solutions
Strength of proposal and creativity
Mastery of data tools and strong analytical skills
Fluent in English & French

  • Strength of proposal and creativity
  • Mastery of data tools and strong analytical skills
  • Fluent in English & French

Title: Transportation Data Analyst (Citymapper)
Description:
At Citymapper (powered by Via), we’re on a mission to help make complex cities more accessible to everyday users. Our application transports millions of people in hundreds of cities around the world by giving them access to the most current and sophisticated transportation options available. We make getting around your favorite city easy, so that you can enjoy the ride.

As a Transportation Data Analyst (French-speaking) at Citymapper, you will be managing the data that is the backbone of our application’s success. Y our work directly impacts our user experience, and is the difference between a user seeing a bus drive away, or reaching it just in time. Millions of users around the world trust our application to be on time for work, a job interview, or a date - and we take great responsibility in fulfilling that need.

This job can be done remotely if you're based in England, the Netherlands, Germany or Bulgaria. If you prefer hybrid, we have offices in London, Berlin, Paris, Amsterdam, and Sofia.

What You'll Do:


You will help to manage the timetable data that powers the Citymapper application. Using proprietary tools and methods, you will transform often messy transit schedules into shiny and reliable user information.
You will build, validate and ship data to production on a daily basis.
You will manage data in a range of cities and across different formats.
You will work with our engineers to build for scale by improving tools and automating tasks.
You will ensure data quality in our web and mobile products so that users continue to love and trust Citymapper.


Who You Are:


Fluent French speaker (C1 and above)
You have a passion for public transportation and cities, and an interest in how public transportation networks operate.
You are comfortable dealing with large data sets, and have an eagerness to learn new data skills.
You take a hands-on, practical, pragmatic attitude to your work.
You have exceptional attention to detail, and an ability to communicate those details to other collaborators.
You have up to 3 years of experience working with data, Python and/or common transit data formats (GTFS, TransXChange, Siri, Hafas, etc).


What We Offer:


Becoming part of Via, a company that was awarded for its commitment to social good
Joining the team working on the industry-leading mobile app that is loved and trusted by millions of users
State of the art hardware for you to perform your work worry free
Ongoing support and training to ensure you have the resources you need to thrive and progress in your career
A hybrid or remote work model. Remote work is possible if you're based in one of these countries: England, Germany or Netherlands
Competitive compensation
Monthly health stipend
25 vacation days


We’re Via, and we build technology that changes the way the world moves. We pioneered the TransitTech category to ensure that the future of transportation is shared, dynamic public mobility — the kind that reduces carbon emissions across congested cities, minimizes reliance on private cars, and provides everyone with accessible, efficient, and affordable ways of getting around.

We created the first end-to-end TransitTech solution for cities and transit agencies, offering world-class software, service design, and operational expertise to fundamentally improve the way the world moves.

Via was founded with the guiding principle that we go further when we go together. We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace. If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles. All backgrounds, identities, and voices are welcomed and celebrated at Via.

Ready to join the ride?

Via is an equal opportunity employer.


Show more
