Title: Associate Data Analyst, Revenue
Description:
We’re looking for curious analysts interested in being considered for a Data Analyst role in the Advanced Data Analytics team and who are buzzing to solve impactful questions for exciting products in the online dating industry and beyond.

In this role, you’ll support our stakeholders with data and insights related to a variety of business areas. You’ll be involved in experimentation design and planning, visualisations, trend diagnostics, dashboarding and much, much more. 




What you’ll do
You’ll have access to the most diverse, varied and complex data sets in the technology world right now (10’s of billions of data points per day!!)
You’ll be doing all the typical day-to-day tasks such as generating practical insights from the data, manipulating complex datasets, helping us understand how to improve and optimise our members experience to facilitate the creation of meaningful, equitable and healthy relationships
Unlock your potential by upskilling in SQL, Python and other essential tools, empowering you to expand your skill set and excel in your career
You will help uncover tactical and strategic insights and support experimentation in a range of areas such as revenue management, operations and strategy. For instance, you could work on testing and validating pricing and promotion based opportunities across our portfolio of apps. 
You will make contributions to the data model and could contribute to building out data pipelines
You’ll collaborate closely with several potential teams including Product Managers, strategists, operations managers, and Data Engineers PLUS, you’ll be building detailed, entrepreneurial and business-minded insights that directly contribute to the successful growth of Bumble Inc





You have confidence in the following:
You are a data analyst with expertise in SQL, data visualisation, A/B testing, statistical knowledge and storytelling, etc, is entrepreneurial, gets excited about building from scratch, and is relentlessly experimenting in pursuit of building a product that members love. 
Supporting experimentation analytics (e.g. A/B testing, user group testing): significance analysis, non-parametric methods, bootstrapping, causal inference
Manipulating complex datasets using a range of tools such as SQL and Hive
Building effective self serve tools and visualisations to help optimise decision making
Engaging and collaborating with key stakeholders such as developers, product managers, and senior management
Identifying issues and opportunities, translating business problems into analytical diagnoses and delivering insights that answer the most pressing questions
Supporting engineers and teammates in improving data quality, and specifying requirements for new data collection
Partnering with the wider analytics / data science team to solve business problems
Experience in Python is desirable but not required
Experience with data modelling and make domain-specific data models is a plus





Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Allica bank

Allica is the UK’s fastest growing company - and the fastest-growing financial technology (fintech) firm ever. Our purpose is to help established SMEs, one of the last major underserved opportunities in fintech. Established SMEs are the backbone of local communities - representing over a third of our economy - yet have been largely neglected both by traditional high street banks and modern fintech providers




Role Description

Data is a key asset to Allica and is deeply embedded in all our teams and products. With data, we assist and work with Finance, Operations, Credit Risk, Product and management. This role will be for the Lending Tribe.




We are looking for ambitious and curious people who can help us understand our data better, contribute to facilitating the discussions between engineering and the data stakeholders and have an impact on the business by telling stories around the insights they generate.




You will be an integral part of the lending data squad, and the initial focus will be scaling up our ability to deliver analytics/insights that shape our understanding of the business and enhancing our foundations for automated reporting




Principal Accountabilities

Understand our products and processes through the data we have or collect
Work with the Lending Tribe and other stakeholders (Ops, risk, etc) to understand their data needs and provide solutions that address the core need (not just the immediate request)
Contribute meaningful insights from our data that proactively drive decisions and new lines of inquiry
Build visualizations and reports that enable the Lending business to service their ongoing data needs and measure KPIs
Develop data knowledge base (definitions, working rhythms etc.) within the team that enables us to become an information hub for the business




Personal Attributes & Experience

Previous experience working as a data analyst (in finance is desirable but not essential)
You like to investigate and challenge narratives using data
The ability to write queries in SQL with logic to combine multiple data sources
You work well with stakeholders across the business.
You communicate effectively and are comfortable with learning how to translate technical detail into business and commercial language.
You have a solid foundation in Python programming OR a strong desire to learn




Don’t tick every box?

Don’t worry if you don’t have all the skills or requirements listed on the job description. If you think you’ll be a good fit, we’d still love to hear from you!




Flexible working

We know the ‘9-to-5’ isn’t right for everyone. That’s why Allica Bank is fully committed to flexible and hybrid working. Please let us know what is best for you and, if we can, we will do our best to accommodate.




Diversity

We’re a diverse bunch here at Allica, with all kinds of experiences, backgrounds and lifestyles. Our openness and differences make us stronger, and we want everybody to feel comfortable bringing as much of themselves to work with them as they like.




Additional Information

Working at Allica Bank

At Allica Bank we want to ensure our employees have the right tools and environment in which to succeed in their role and in support of our customers.




Our employees are at the heart of everything we do, so our benefits are designed with you in mind:

Full onboarding support and continued development opportunities
Options for flexible working
Regular social activities
25 days holiday – with the option to Buy/Sell
Pension contributions
Discretionary bonus scheme
Private health cover (with the option to add family members)
Life assurance
Income Protection
Family friendly policies including enhanced Maternity & Paternity leave
Season ticket loans
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Role

At Deliveroo we have an outstanding data science organisation, with a mission to enable the highest quality human and machine decision-making. We work throughout the company - in product, business and platform teams - using analysis, experimentation, causal inference and machine learning techniques. We are uniquely placed to use data to help make better decisions and improve data literacy across Deliveroo.

We are looking for a Data Analyst that is passionate about metrics and telling the stories behind the data. We have several roles open across different teams (grocery, loyalty, restaurants). Data Analysts at Deliveroo report into our data science management team.

You will be a professional in insights storytelling, communication and visualisation and know how to create action from metrics. Crafting effective intelligent benchmarks, understanding performance, caring about data quality, enabling automation and creating phenomenal visualisations and stories are things that drive you.

What you'll be doing



Work closely with commercial stakeholders to create value and business impact through better data availability, visualisation and analysis
Discover, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets to perform ad-hoc analyses and deliver insights to the executive team and senior management
Understand key drivers of the business and provide data driven guidance on key levers
Identify and specify data needs and quality requirements and work closely with Analytics Engineers to ensure data is available, accurate and corresponds to the business needs
Consolidate and distribute best analytical practices from different teams and countries



Requirements



Experience identifying the root cause of problems, assessing risks/impacts and determining and implementing effective solutions.
A good understanding of querying in SQL and understanding of database structure - you'll be expected to be able to extract the data you need for your analysis.
Compelling story-telling skills, and an eye for powerful visualisations - you'll need to translate your findings for all levels of stakeholder (business and technical)
Good knowledge of Excel/GSheets - depending on the task, there is a good chance that this is where some of your exploratory analysis will take place. Being comfortable with pivot tables and functions will be essential.
Developer experience with a data visualisation tool (Looker, Tableau, Periscope)



Why Deliveroo

Our mission is to transform the way you shop and eat, bringing the neighbourhood to your door by connecting consumers, restaurants, shops and riders. . We are transforming the way the world eats and shops by making access to food and products more convenient and enjoyable. We give people the opportunity to buy what they want, as they want it, when and where they want it.

We are a technology-driven company at the forefront of the most rapidly expanding industry in the world. We are still a small team, making a very large impact, looking to answer some of the most interesting questions out there. We move fast, value autonomy and ownership, and we are always looking for new ideas.

Workplace & Benefits

At Deliveroo we know that people are the heart of the business and we prioritise their welfare. Benefits differ by country, but we offer many benefits in areas including healthcare, well-being, parental leave, pensions, and generous annual leave allowances, including time off to support a charitable cause of your choice. Benefits are country-specific, please ask your recruiter for more information. This role in a Hybrid position.

Diversity

At Deliveroo, we believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when it comes to any one of the things that make you who you are - your gender, race, sexuality, religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest-growing businesses in a rapidly growing industry.

We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion in all aspects of our hiring process. We recognise that some candidates may require adjustments to apply for a position or fairly participate in the interview process. If you require any adjustments, please don't hesitate to let us know. We will make every effort to provide the necessary adjustments to ensure you have an equitable opportunity to succeed.

Please click here to view our candidate privacy policy.

Please click here to view our candidate privacy policy.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
We are keen to speak with junior data analysts about joining an investment management client of ours, based in Central London. This will be on a 12-month contract with an expectation to be extended or taken on permanently upon completion.




This is a hybrid position with 3 days in the office.




This role offers a unique opportunity for a Junior Data Analyst to grow within a dynamic and challenging environment. You'll be working on a high-profile client project, gaining hands-on experience with large datasets and contributing to data-driven strategies.




You will be responsible for:

Managing and processing large datasets, ensuring accuracy and efficiency.
Developing and maintaining dashboards to support data visualisation and decision-making.
Analysing data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business strategies.
Collaborating with stakeholders and clients to understand their data needs and deliver actionable insights.




Requirements

University Graduates with 0-2 years of experience
A keen interest to work in Investment Management
Keen to identify and embrace new technologies and new ways of working
Experience in Power BI and SQL (Desirable)
Effective prioritisation and organisational skills
Excellent communication skills, both written and oral
Good IT skills, including Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook




Benefits

£30,000 for graduates with less than 1 year of experience, up to £50,000 for graduates with 2+ years of experience.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Amex GBT is a place where colleagues find inspiration in travel as a force for good and – through their work – can make an impact on our industry. We’re here to help our colleagues achieve success and offer an inclusive and collaborative culture where your voice is valued.

Ready to explore a career path? Start your journey.

Job Description

Job Description for Data Analyst

This position is a highly visible and integral role within the Global Business Partnerships (GBP) team which is responsible for driving revenue by establishing and growing key partnerships. Our team works very closely with stakeholders across the organization with regular exposure to senior leadership.

Right now, we are looking for a forward-thinking, data driven analyst with strong commercial competence and proven thought leadership to join the GRM team.

What you will do:

Provide detailed commercial insights to support complex performance improvement initiatives

Closely collaborate with the optimization team to scope new revenue opportunities, and develop and roll-out pre/post reporting for key business initiatives

Review performance of the hotel business; develop and communicate insights into performance drivers, identify key risks and opportunities.

Participate in stakeholder meetings where detailed data and analytics will be communicated to varying levels up to senior leadership

Demonstrate strong communication skills translating complex data into key messages and presenting to stakeholders

What we’re looking for:

Excellent analytical mentality with broad commercial competence and thought leadership to generate relevant insights on performance

Able to work with data at a detailed level while keeping an eye on the broader strategy

Excellent communication skills; must be able to translate sophisticated data into key messages that will be delivered to leadership teams

Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment

Educated to degree level ideally in a numerate subject

Demonstrated experience of working in an analytical role

Ability to translate large amounts of data into clear practical insights

Strong collaborator engagement skills including communications, time management and prioritisation skills

Ability to understand business processes and commercial implications to make strategic recommendations

Strong Excel Skills Is Essential

PowerBI and SQL proficiency would be a plus

Ability to travel as needed

#GBTJobs

Location

United Kingdom

The #TeamGBT Experience

Work and life: Find your happy medium at Amex GBT.


Flexible benefits are tailored to each country and start the day you do. These include health and welfare insurance plans, retirement programs, parental leave, adoption assistance, and more.
Travel perks: get a choice of deals each week from major travel providers on everything from flights to hotels to cruises and car rentals.
Develop the skills you want when the time is right for you, with global tuition assistance, access to over 20,000 courses on our learning platform, leadership courses, and new job openings available to internal candidates first.
We strive to champion Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion in every aspect of our business at GBT. You can connect with colleagues through our global Inclusion Groups, centered around common identities or initiatives, to discuss challenges, obstacles, achievements, and drive company awareness and action.
Wellbeing resources to support mental and emotional health for you and your immediate family.
And much more!



All applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to age, sex, gender (and characteristics related to sex and gender), pregnancy (and related medical conditions), race, color, citizenship, religion, disability, or any other class or characteristic protected by law.

Furthermore, we are committed to providing reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please let your recruiter know if you need an accommodation at any point during the hiring process. For details regarding how we protect your data, please consult GBT Recruitment Privacy Statement.

HTML:
Amex GBT is a place where colleagues find inspiration in travel as a force for good and – through their work – can make an impact on our industry. We’re here to help our colleagues achieve success and offer an inclusive and collaborative culture where your voice is valued.

Ready to explore a career path? Start your journey.

Job Description

Job Description for Data Analyst

This position is a highly visible and integral role within the Global Business Partnerships (GBP) team which is responsible for driving revenue by establishing and growing key partnerships. Our team works very closely with stakeholders across the organization with regular exposure to senior leadership.

Right now, we are looking for a forward-thinking, data driven analyst with strong commercial competence and proven thought leadership to join the GRM team.

What you will do:

Provide detailed commercial insights to support complex performance improvement initiatives

Closely collaborate with the optimization team to scope new revenue opportunities, and develop and roll-out pre/post reporting for key business initiatives

Review performance of the hotel business; develop and communicate insights into performance drivers, identify key risks and opportunities.

Participate in stakeholder meetings where detailed data and analytics will be communicated to varying levels up to senior leadership

Demonstrate strong communication skills translating complex data into key messages and presenting to stakeholders

What we’re looking for:

Excellent analytical mentality with broad commercial competence and thought leadership to generate relevant insights on performance

Able to work with data at a detailed level while keeping an eye on the broader strategy

Excellent communication skills; must be able to translate sophisticated data into key messages that will be delivered to leadership teams

Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment

Educated to degree level ideally in a numerate subject

Demonstrated experience of working in an analytical role

Ability to translate large amounts of data into clear practical insights

Strong collaborator engagement skills including communications, time management and prioritisation skills

Ability to understand business processes and commercial implications to make strategic recommendations

Strong Excel Skills Is Essential

PowerBI and SQL proficiency would be a plus

Ability to travel as needed

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Central London - Hybrid




Coltech is partnered with an exciting startup organisation based in the heart of Central London. They are focused on digital advertising and work with many leading organisations globally.




They seek a Data Analyst to join their analytics team; the successful candidate will be responsible for driving insights from key products. You will play a vital role in shaping product analytics while working alongside a dynamic team passionate about problem-solving.




Responsibilities

Identify and deliver insights for key products, including Deals, Apps, Experimentation Platforms, and Identity Protection tools.
Collaborate with the product team to support monetisation, product development, and decision-making.
Provide technical expertise to manipulate and transform large datasets, translating analytical findings into actionable stakeholder insights.
Dive into complex datasets to identify opportunities that drive the delivery of initiatives across various product lines.
Leverage a centralised reporting framework to support monetisation and strategic decision-making.
Collaborate with product and data stakeholders to develop and maintain data models and performance measurements for new product experiments.




Required Experience/Skills

Professional experience in data analytics and reporting.
Strong proficiency in SQL for querying and manipulating large datasets.
Experience with BI / Data visualisation tools.
Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform, Big Query, Looker, or similar tools is a plus.
Attention to detail with a focus on accuracy and data integrity.
Bachelor’s degree in a related field.




Desirable Skills

Any experience with BigQuery is a plus
Any experience with Looker is a plus
Experience working in a GCP environment is a plus




Alongside being a great company to work for, the company also offers a very competitive benefits package.




If you're looking to work in a dynamic and growing

Title: Graduate/Junior Data Analyst - Oxford
Description:
Graduate/Junior Data Analyst - Oxford

Full time - 4 days per week in Oxford (OX4) offices & 1 day WFH

£25,000-£30,000 dep on experience

Reference: J12856




Full long term UK working rights required - no sponsorship available




An exciting opportunity for a Junior Data Analyst has arisen within a dynamic data consultancy. Collaborating with Senior Analysts and Engineers you will develop your analytical capabilities working in a cloud based environment. You will be a self-starter who is inquisitive by nature and passionate about data. Whether you have studied a degree, attended a data boot camp or are a career transitioner, keen to start an analytical career, then this could be the role for you.

Working in a small, collaborative environment, dealing with huge quantities of data, you will get the opportunity to be involved in various client facing and complex analytics projects.




Responsibilities:

· Data collection, querying and preparation

· Data analysis using tools such as Excel and SQL

· Provide insight and trends to the business

· Dashboard and report development using data visualisation tools such as Tableau or PowerBI

· Build predictive models using AI tools

· Collaborate with Senior Analyst on complex analyses including client projects

· Continuous development with new tools techniques and methodologies

· Contribute to data governance policies and best practice




Experience:

· Excellent communication skill - written and verbal

· Excellent problem solving skills

· Critical thinking and attention to detail

· Knowledge of Excel and SQL

· Experience of Tableau or PowerBI is advantageous

· Knowledge of Google Workspace tools

· Numerical Bachelor's degree, Datacamp training or other analytical training courses.




This is an incredible opportunity to join a forward thinking company that will offer a rewarding and supportive environment to work in. If this sounds like the role for you, then get in touch today - make an application!




Alternatively, you can refer a friend or colleague by taking part in our fantastic referral schemes! If you have a friend or colleague who would be interested in this role, please refer them to us. For each relevant candidate that you introduce to us (there is no limit) and we place, you will be entitled to our general gift/voucher scheme.




Datatech is one of the UK’s leading recruitment agencies in the field of analytics and host of the critically acclaimed event, Women in Data. For more information, visit our website: www.datatech.org.uk

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ESG DATA ANALYST




London




£250 - 300 per day (Inside IR35)




6 month assignment










Role Overview







The ESG Data Analyst will support the ESG Team in developing and enhancing climate reporting capabilities, ESG data analytics, and data visualization tools. The role involves working closely with the ESG Climate Research Lead and ESG Strategy Team on various data-related initiatives.




Key Responsibilities

Support development of climate reporting capabilities across the business and affiliates
Assist with ESG data and analytics tools, helping teams understand and utilize them
Create data visualization tools for ESG and climate metrics using PowerBI, Tableau, etc.
Develop innovative data tools to analyze climate and ESG risks/opportunities
Support strategic planning by enhancing visualization of internal ESG AUM data
Track asset flows and integrate external ESG market data
Benchmark against market trends and summarize emerging risks/opportunities
Support the ESG Council's Data & Technology Working Group
Track and share ESG data-related market, regulatory and thematic developments
Assist with ESG data queries and discrete projects like marketing collateral
Help develop affiliate-level ESG KPIs where appropriate

Required Skills

Strong interest in ESG/climate topics and practical solutions for investors
Advanced data manipulation and Excel skills
Experience with data visualization tools (PowerBI, Tableau, etc.)
Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities
Strong attention to detail and accuracy
Collaborative, self-motivated, and well-organized
Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Desired Skills

Experience in a data-related or quantitative role
Strong interpersonal and influencing skills

The ideal candidate will combine technical data skills with ESG knowledge to support ESG initiatives through analytics, reporting, and visualization capabilities. The role requires both analytical rigor and creative approaches to deriving insights from ESG data.




EXCELLENT OPPORTUNITY TO JOIN A WORLD CLAAS ASSET MANAGEMENT FIRM

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position: Data Analyst

Location: Manchester, Scotland

Salary: 35K DOE




About the Role:

Our client is seeking a talented Data Analyst to join their dynamic team. This role offers the chance to work on diverse projects, using your analytical skills to drive strategic decisions and influence key business outcomes.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyse complex data sets to identify trends and patterns
Develop and maintain reports and dashboards to support business operations
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data needs and deliver actionable insights
Utilise statistical methods to solve problems and support decision-making processes




Who We're Looking For:

Experience: Minimum of 1 year in a data analyst role preferred, but not essential. Recent graduates with a First-Class degree in a relevant field (e.g., Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science) are also encouraged to apply.
Skills: Proficiency in data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, SQL, Python, R). Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.
Attributes: Excellent communication skills, the ability to work independently and as part of a team, and a proactive approach to learning and development.
If you’re ready to take the next step in your career and make a real impact with your analytical skills, we’d love to hear from you!

Description:
Arcus Search are proud to support a global London Market Insurance / Reinsurance firm, on searching for an adaptable Data Analyst with strong SQL and Power BI skills.




You will be joining them on a permanent basis, to support the business in requirements analysis, detailed preparation of varying data and informative data visualisation to support decision-making ran by the business teams.




What you'll do:

Design and implement reports using Power BI
Facilitate user-friendly reports and dashboards, improving these at all times
Collaborate with the team and key stakeholders and decision makers.
Error analysis and data testing, ensuring it's of good quality and consistent
Data extraction and enrichment using advanced SQL functions

3-5 years in a Data-driven role with ability to use Excel and BI tools at an intermediate level
Experience with Power BI and Power BI Stack
Extensive SQL skills
Data quality and exceptions handling
Ability to articulate complex ideas and deliver these to senior users and stakeholders.




This is an incredible opportunity for someone who has a proven track record as a Data Analyst, eager to enter the world of Insurance. This business is growing and expanding globally, seeing a lot of successes across their industry thus far, so a shared value in working for a collaborative and innovative environment is a must.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Search
Description:
Teamwork makes the stream work.

Roku Is Changing How The World Watches TV

Roku is the #1 TV streaming platform in the US, and we've set our sights on powering every television in the world. Roku pioneered streaming to the TV. Our mission is to be the TV streaming platform that connects the entire TV ecosystem. We connect consumers to the content they love, enable content publishers to build and monetize large audiences, and provide advertisers unique capabilities to engage consumers.

From your first day at Roku, you'll make a valuable - and valued - contribution. We're a fast-growing public company where no one is a bystander. We offer you the opportunity to delight millions of TV streamers around the world while gaining meaningful experience across a variety of disciplines.

About The Team

The Core Analytics Team is a centralised function to provide data-driven insights to business and products. We collaborate closely with our Product and Engineering teams to deliver the best search experiences to our customers and maximise the value proposition for the business.

About The Role

Roku is looking for a Sr. Data Analyst/Scientist to join the Core Analytics team supporting our Search product. This individual will be responsible for understanding how users leverage our search product to manage their Roku experience and work closely with product management and engineering to identify opportunities to create new features, drive their adoption, and generate value for Roku. This individual will investigate and develop solutions to track, monitor, and improve our search ecosystem. The successful candidate is quantitatively driven, detail-focused, and possesses an elevated level of problem-solving expertise.

This role can be based in Manchester, or Cambridge and requires you to be in the office three days a week.

What You'll Be Doing


Define and monitor KPIs that guide the growth of Roku’s Search product.
Analyse structured and unstructured data and communicate insights to help stakeholders solve business problems, identify trends and make data-driven decisions
Develop necessary data pipelines to power automation, validation and reporting
Collaborate with stakeholders to align data science initiatives with organisational goals and strategy design and execute AB tests
Develop analytical tools (real-time alerts, models, etc.) to understand what drives success for our search platform
Perform exploratory data analysis on emerging trends and execute advanced analysis across the entire search and Roku Platform
Collaborate with the Program Management and Engineering team to proactively seek and incorporate feedback
Providing feedback directly to search leadership on performance of various initiatives and untapped opportunities


We're excited if you have


5+ years of work experience with a bachelor's degree or master's degree in quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Business Analytics, Data Science, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering or Computer Science)
5+ years of experience across search, consumer product, digital media or entertainment industries
Expertise in SQL, SAS, R, Python or other programming language to query data and perform analysis
Hands on experience with visualization tools like Tableau or Looker
Have a bias towards action in resolving issues and operate in a high-energy, fast-paced environment
Hands on experience in A/B testing and statistical modeling/forecasting


Benefits

Roku is committed to offering a diverse range of benefits as part of our compensation package to support our employees and their families. Our comprehensive benefits include global access to mental health and financial wellness support and resources. Local benefits include statutory and voluntary benefits which may include healthcare (medical, dental, and vision), life, accident, disability, commuter, and retirement options (401(k)/pension). Our employees can take time off work for vacation and other personal reasons to balance their evolving work and life needs. It's important to note that not every benefit is available in all locations or for every role. For details specific to your location, please consult with your recruiter.

The Roku Culture

Roku is a great place for people who want to work in a fast-paced environment where everyone is focused on the company's success rather than their own. We try to surround ourselves with people who are great at their jobs, who are easy to work with, and who keep their egos in check. We appreciate a sense of humor. We believe a fewer number of very talented folks can do more for less cost than a larger number of less talented teams. We’re independent thinkers with big ideas who act boldly, move fast and accomplish extraordinary things through collaboration and trust. In short, at Roku you'll be part of a company that's changing how the world watches TV. 

We have a unique culture that we are proud of. We think of ourselves primarily as problem-solvers, which itself is a two-part idea. We come up with the solution, but the solution isn't real until it is built and delivered to the customer. That penchant for action gives us a pragmatic approach to innovation, one that has served us well since 2002. 

To learn more about Roku, our global footprint, and how we've grown, visit https://www.weareroku.com/factsheet.

By providing your information, you acknowledge that you have read our Applicant Privacy Notice and authorize Roku to process your data subject to those terms.


Show more
HTML:
Teamwork makes the stream work.

Roku Is Changing How The World Watches TV

Roku is the #1 TV streaming platform in the US, and we've set our sights on powering every television in the world. Roku pioneered streaming to the TV. Our mission is to be the TV streaming platform that connects the entire TV ecosystem. We connect consumers to the content they love, enable content publishers to build and monetize large audiences, and provide advertisers unique capabilities to engage consumers.

From your first day at Roku, you'll make a valuable - and valued - contribution. We're a fast-growing public company where no one is a bystander. We offer you the opportunity to delight millions of TV streamers around the world while gaining meaningful experience across a variety of disciplines.

About The Team

The Core Analytics Team is a centralised function to provide data-driven insights to business and products. We collaborate closely with our Product and Engineering teams to deliver the best search experiences to our customers and maximise the value proposition for the business.

About The Role

Roku is looking for a Sr. Data Analyst/Scientist to join the Core Analytics team supporting our Search product. This individual will be responsible for understanding how users leverage our search product to manage their Roku experience and work closely with product management and engineering to identify opportunities to create new features, drive their adoption, and generate value for Roku. This individual will investigate and develop solutions to track, monitor, and improve our search ecosystem. The successful candidate is quantitatively driven, detail-focused, and possesses an elevated level of problem-solving expertise.

This role can be based in Manchester, or Cambridge and requires you to be in the office three days a week.

What You'll Be Doing

  • Define and monitor KPIs that guide the growth of Roku’s Search product.
  • Analyse structured and unstructured data and communicate insights to help stakeholders solve business problems, identify trends and make data-driven decisions
  • Develop necessary data pipelines to power automation, validation and reporting
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to align data science initiatives with organisational goals and strategy design and execute AB tests
  • Develop analytical tools (real-time alerts, models, etc.) to understand what drives success for our search platform
  • Perform exploratory data analysis on emerging trends and execute advanced analysis across the entire search and Roku Platform
  • Collaborate with the Program Management and Engineering team to proactively seek and incorporate feedback
  • Providing feedback directly to search leadership on performance of various initiatives and untapped opportunities

We're excited if you have

  • 5+ years of work experience with a bachelor's degree or master's degree in quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Business Analytics, Data Science, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering or Computer Science)
  • 5+ years of experience across search, consumer product, digital media or entertainment industries
  • Expertise in SQL, SAS, R, Python or other programming language to query data and perform analysis
  • Hands on experience with visualization tools like Tableau or Looker
  • Have a bias towards action in resolving issues and operate in a high-energy, fast-paced environment
  • Hands on experience in A/B testing and statistical modeling/forecasting

Benefits

Roku is committed to offering a diverse range of benefits as part of our compensation package to support our employees and their families. Our comprehensive benefits include global access to mental health and financial wellness support and resources. Local benefits include statutory and voluntary benefits which may include healthcare (medical, dental, and vision), life, accident, disability, commuter, and retirement options (401(k)/pension). Our employees can take time off work for vacation and other personal reasons to balance their evolving work and life needs. It's important to note that not every benefit is available in all locations or for every role. For details specific to your location, please consult with your recruiter.

We believe a fewer number of very talented folks can do more for less cost than a larger number of less talented teams. We’re independent thinkers with big ideas who act boldly, move fast and accomplish extraordinary things through collaboration and trust. In short, at Roku you'll be part of a company that's changing how the world watches TV. 

We have a unique culture that we are proud of. We think of ourselves primarily as problem-solvers, which itself is a two-part idea. We come up with the solution, but the solution isn't real until it is built and delivered to the customer. That penchant for action gives us a pragmatic approach to innovation, one that has served us well since 2002.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

£35,000 - £40,000 + 10% bonus + benefits

London (2 days per week in the office)




Our client




Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate €22.9bn revenue.




With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Liberty’s, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, Hermès, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.




Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.




The role




The Data Analyst will help the business to understand customer needs and behaviours through the analysis of complex data sets and subsequent translation into meaningful, shareable insights and stories.




This role will be hands on with building visualisations in Tableau and ad hoc analysis (using SQL) to inform the optimisation of products and features.




As a Data Analyst, you will:




Monitor and report on key KPIs.
Deep-dive (using SQL) into customer data to provide product teams with detailed customer analysis.
Be hands-on with building visualisations in Tableau.
Identify data requirements, working with international data teams to ensure data is cleansed and prepared.
Support with the identification of new and innovative ways to leverage data to deliver new customer engagement opportunities, optimise channels and deliver economic efficiency.
Deliver enhanced customer profiling and segmentation.
Measure the effectiveness of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Provide ad-hoc analysis to inform the optimisation of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Advise on how advanced statistical and analytical techniques can further improve the understanding of customers.




To apply, you should have




Experience working as a Data Analyst with good exposure to statistical methodologies.
Intermediate SQL skills.
Advanced experience with Tableau (or a similar tool).
Advanced Excel skills.
Proven experience delivering impactful and actionable insights with a B2C environment.




The perks include




25 days holiday + bank holidays.
An extra day off for moving to a new house; 2 days off for your wedding; 3 days off for charity / community days.
Private healthcare and medical cashback plan.
Perkbox.
Competitive pension plan.
Virgin gym membership.

Match Digital specialises in connecting talented individuals with businesses in the digital, tech, media and marcomms industries.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
JOB TITLE –Data Analyst - Marketing

Location - London




Your New Company

With over 244 offices in 33 countries across the globe, Hays are the largest specialist recruitment agency. Hays is recognised in the recruitment sector for its industry leading training & development opportunities.




Role Objectives

The Senior Data Analyst works within the UK&I Marketing Department to develop and deliver reporting and insight analysis to all business stakeholders.







Responsibilities

Creating dashboards and reports using Excel and Power BI
Support the monitoring of marketing campaign performance across the department
Maintain and deliver monthly KPI and ROI reporting for the UK&I management board and to support the marketing planning team at regional ops meetings
Creating and maintaining documentation for processes and best practices
Improve access to data sets and bring together to automate use where possible.







Skills and Competencies

Good understanding of Marketing Principles
Work autonomously, but collaboratively, demonstrating ownership in ALL activities
Demonstrates behaviour which supports the Hays brand values: Expert; Ambitious; Inquisitive; Passionate about People
Capable of interpreting data in order to make sound and timely business decisions
MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint skills essential
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work effectively under pressure and to strict deadlines




Essential

Proven ability to design visually impactful dashboards and tell a meaningful story
Experience with complex DAX queries
Using Power Query to load, transform, and curate the data
Strong SQL skills for querying and creation of views/tables, functions, and stored procedures
Logical mindset and strong attention to details
Project management skills




Desirable:

Proficiency in Excel (pivot tables, formulas, shortcuts etc)
Experience with SFMC automations
Knowledge of Python
Experience with Microsoft Azure platform & service (eg DataFactory, Fabric)
Proficiency in PowerPoint
Experience with Google Analytics/Looker Studio




What you will get in return

As a global FTSE 250 business, Hays can offer you all the tools for a successful career. This is the ideal opportunity for someone with minimal experience looking to build a career in Bids and Contracts. You’ll join the team with clear objectives set out for career progression plus all the training and support you could ask for. Hays works on a flexible hybrid basis where you’ll be able to work 50% from home and 50% from our central offices. You’ll also have access to all our wide range of benefits including cycle to work, private healthcare options, buy & sell leave, shopping discounts, dedicated services for mental health support & wellbeing plus a monthly wellbeing hour to use at your own discretion plus our paid volunteering day for all employees under our Working for Your Tomorrow InitiativCulture built on rewarding success and the opportunity to influence your earning potential.




Best technology in the industry and a renowned training programme to support success and drive rapid career progression and ongoing development
Flexible hybrid working patterns
Opportunity to take your career globally
Incentives and rewards to recognise performance both locally, regionally and nationally
Broad range of employee wellbeing initiatives and benefits
Referral bonus scheme
Community of internal support networks.
Paid volunteering days for all employees under our Working for Your Tomorrow Initiative.




Life at Hays presents the opportunity for growth, varied career paths, exciting challenges and a culture of inclusion that celebrates diversity. As a committed Disability Confident employer, if you’re thinking of a new tomorrow for your career, whatever your background, let’s work together to create it!




At Hays, we share a passion for creating a culture of opportunities for our people to flourish and succeed, whatever your background. We know that diversity of perspective and an inclusive approach, which encourages those experiences and views to be heard, is great for business and therefore your career.

Show more

Title: Graduate Data Analyst
Description:
Graduate Data Analyst Opportunity - Become an Expert in Business Change and IT Transformation




24 Month Fixed Term Contract | Bristol | £26,000 (Year 1)




Eager to springboard your career into the exhilarating world of Business Change? Look no further! Here’s an exclusive opportunity to join ea Change, a renowned firm committed to shaping the next generation of Change and IT leaders.




About us

ea Change, with over two decades of expertise in managing Business and IT transformations, is at the forefront of facilitating meaningful, lasting change for clients across the spectrum. With a firm foundation in fostering long-lasting partnerships, we're committed to upskilling and developing future leaders through our Futures Programme. We pride ourselves on a culture that prioritises diversity, inclusion, kindness, integrity, and most importantly, people.




About the role

Your journey will begin with us at ea Change, where you will join our friendly team, ready to be deployed onsite with our clients to work on a project of theirs. You will initially embark on this journey as a Data Analyst under the guidance of an expert in the field, learning the necessary skills needed to work in a Change environment. Our in-house Change experts work closely with your on-site manager to guide your career into either a Software Development, Data Analytics or Automation direction. This opportunity is a fast-track into an exciting and dynamic world where forward-thinking, innovation, and confidence to express oneself are the keys to success.




We understand what is needed to work in the challenging environment of business change and we will support you throughout your time with our clients. With monthly catchups with ea Directors, a buddy system for a phone call at any time, training and mentorship provided by our in-house Change experts, and a fully funded, bespoke, accredited training programme; our Data Analysts are an integral part of the ea family.




Requirements

This role requires a full driving licence and access to a car
Possession of a technical undergraduate degree
Right to work in the United Kingdom
Strong soft skills, excellent communication abilities
Exceptional problem-solving skills and meticulous attention to detail
Strong GCSE and A-Level grades (or equivalent)
A passionate interest in Change and IT




Benefits

Salary increase to £32,000 in year 2
Fully funded accredited qualifications
Bespoke flexible training
A health cash plan
26 days annual leave
Regular mentoring and personal development
Access to a comprehensive learning portal
Opportunities for progression and a robust fast-track into Business Change
Hybrid working and commercial exposure




At ea Change, you will find a vibrant community that wholeheartedly believes in pushing boundaries, embracing innovation, and celebrating diversity. We assure an ambience where everyone is encouraged to express themselves, contributing to our shared goal of shaping the future of business success.




How to Apply

If you're captivated by this opportunity and fit the bill, we'd be thrilled to hear from you so kindly submit your up-to-date CV. Together, let's shape the future!




ea Change are unable to sponsor work visas for international applicants as we are not on the UK Border Agency's Sponsor Register.




If we are fortunate in receiving a high volume of quality applications we may not be able to get back to everyone individually. Please assume if you have not heard back from the team within 14 days of application, your application has been unsuccessful.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We're on a mission to make the switch to sustainable transport and energy faster, easier and more affordable. We use our own technology stack, data smarts and industry knowledge to build a game-changing capability. Our intelligent energy platform helps our customers access renewable energy, understand consumer behaviour, and powers smart charging for EVs.

The worlds of energy and transport are colliding and Ohme is at the heart of this. By using technology and data integrations to connect cars, chargers, people, energy providers and more, Ohme has a powerful platform that puts the consumer at the core.

Ohme has been selling its chargers to consumers since mid 2019 and has had exponential growth since. We are now operating in multiple countries and have partnerships with the likes of Octopus Energy, Volvo Benelux, VW UK, Mercedes UK, Hyundai UK and other innovative brands.

We are scaling up the business and are building out the team for rapid growth. If you're interested in joining a fast-growing cleantech venture on a journey to speed up the global transition to clean energy, read on!

We are seeking a Data Analyst to join the Data Analytics team at Ohme, someone who thrives on leveraging data to create impactful, user-centric products that foster seamless customer engagement and streamline the journey toward owning an Ohme, ensuring an effortless and satisfying experience. This role will be responsible for supporting the product teams with reporting and analysis to help plan and optimise products while driving A/B testing within the business ensuring decisions are data driven.

Requirements


Bachelor's or Master's degree in STEM, Business Administration or a related field
More than three years experience as a Data Analyst or Product Analyst in technology, energy, transport or customer service sectors is a plus
Experience of using data to drive business decisions within previous roles
Advanced SQL and experience with statistical packages (Excel, SPSS, SAS, etc.). Knowledge of Python is a plus
Familiarity with a BI application such as Power BI, Tableau, Looker, QuickSight or Sigma
Strong understanding of data analysis techniques, with a focus on their application in business contexts
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills, with the ability to work effectively in a dynamic team environment
Experience working with dbt to build and maintain data models



Benefits

You'll get to work in a fast-paced and rapidly growing scale-up with global ambitions, that is cutting edge, passionate about sustainability and seeks to make the world a better place.

Our benefits:


Competitive salary and discretionary bonus
Private Health Insurance
Aegon Pension Scheme
Life Assurance Scheme with death in service benefit of 4x salary
Income Protection Scheme for long term illness


Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are at the heart of what we do and we encourage a culture where everyone can be themselves at work. We actively seek out a diverse range of talent and our policies ensure that every job application and employee is treated fairly, with equal opportunity to succeed and to feel included.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
We are keen to speak with junior data analysts about joining an investment management client of ours, based in Central London. This will be on a 12-month contract with an expectation to be extended or taken on permanently upon completion.




This is a hybrid position with 3 days in the office.




This role offers a unique opportunity for a Junior Data Analyst to grow within a dynamic and challenging environment. You'll be working on a high-profile client project, gaining hands-on experience with large datasets and contributing to data-driven strategies.




You will be responsible for:

Managing and processing large datasets, ensuring accuracy and efficiency.
Developing and maintaining dashboards to support data visualisation and decision-making.
Analysing data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business strategies.
Collaborating with stakeholders and clients to understand their data needs and deliver actionable insights.




Requirements

University Graduates with 0-2 years of experience
A keen interest to work in Investment Management
Keen to identify and embrace new technologies and new ways of working
Experience in Power BI and SQL (Desirable)
Effective prioritisation and organisational skills
Excellent communication skills, both written and oral
Good IT skills, including Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook




Benefits

£30,000 for graduates with less than 1 year of experience, up to £50,000 for graduates with 2+ years of experience.
Show more

  • Developing and maintaining dashboards to support data visualisation and decision-making.
  • Analysing data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business strategies.
  • Collaborating with stakeholders and clients to understand their data needs and deliver actionable insights.


Requirements

  • University Graduates with 0-2 years of experience
  • A keen interest to work in Investment Management
  • Keen to identify and embrace new technologies and new ways of working
  • Experience in Power BI and SQL (Desirable)
  • Effective prioritisation and organisational skills
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and oral
  • Good IT skills, including Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook


Benefits

  • £30,000 for graduates with less than 1 year of experience, up to £50,000 for graduates with 2+ years of experience.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Junior Data Analyst




Want to start a career in tech?

Albany Beck are hiring for passionate individuals to join the Pioneer Technology Programme, to learn the skills to become Junior Data Analysts. This will give you the opportunity to channel your enthusiasm and be part of an Agile team who are always working with exciting technologies. At the end of a short training period, you will be placed into your first full-time position as a Data Analyst with a Public Sector client of ours!




Why Choose the Albany Beck Pioneer Technology Programme?

By choosing to join our Pioneer Technology Programme, you’ll be choosing to work with an organisation that’s passionate about your learning journey and committed to your ongoing professional development. The programme combines a world-class training, with the potential to gain industry standard professional qualifications.




What to expect on the Albany Beck Pioneer Technology Programme

A training course on Data Analysis, where you will learn skills on Python, SQL, PowerBI, AWS and Excel
Deployment to a mainstream Public Sector firm upon completion, allowing you to work with cutting edge technologies.
An Engagement Manager will be assigned to you before your first day who will support you throughout your placement whilst keeping your progression on track, answering any questions about the project and providing upskilling support as required.
A great social environment where you are surrounded by likeminded consultants, you can expect various social events arranged by your Engagement Manager with not just your team but other Pioneers too.




What You Need

Bachelor's degree STEM subject (science, technology, engineering, math) OR, a Non-STEM degree or qualifications provided you have a passion for technology - either through doing online courses, building websites or learning technology in your spare time
British, EEA or Commonwealth Citizen




What You’ll Get

Fully funded training through classes and one on one coaching
Competitive graduate salary, once placed, and half year pay reviews
Ongoing training and support through your designated AB Coach
An inclusive environment, here at AB we believe in increasing representation and making sure everyone can bring their whole self to work. We don't just say the right things, we do the right thing and remove barriers to entry into Technology.

Title: SQL Data Analyst
Description:
SQL Data Analyst




Location: Coventry (on-site)




Salary: £31,000







A rare opportunity to join a growing IT Team located in Coventry as a Business Systems Technician. In this new and exciting role, you will help support the development and delivery of diverse IT systems across the organisation.




Experience working with Applications, SQL and data knowledge is essential to be successful in this opportunity as you will be involved in the management of business systems.




The work that you do will have a meaningful impact on the business. You will also play a vital role in the management and administration of IT Business Systems; this includes identifying improvements, development, support, and assistance to the business.




To be successful in this role our ideal person will have:

An eye for understanding complex design (manufacturing, traceability, integration)
The drive to understand large volumes of data and system patterns.
The confidence to present your products to non-technical audiences.
The ability to adapt your communication style to account for varying levels of seniority and your audiences' requirements
Be able to define requirements, create and maintain documentation and conduct thorough testing of various systems

We will be looking for someone who:




Support design of test script, participating in full regression testing for the key business systems and other associated IT systems – ensuring operational impacts are identified and communicated.
Will develop knowledge of the main business systems – ERP, MES and be able to support day-today activities, including administration and basic development.
Supporting Business System division to monitor end-user system performance, report issues and maintain communications to ensure appropriate resolution.




Essential skills & experience:

Good IT skills
Ability to prioritise
Experience in supporting business applications
Knowledge of MS SQL Server would be advantageous
Ability to analyse data with attention to detail, identify associated trends and root cause of issues, implementing corrective action, as and when required.
Writing complex SQL queries
Ability to deploy hardware and software configuration
Proven analytical and problem solving ability
Strong written and verbal communication skills




Applying for the opportunity:







If you feel you have the required skills identified for this opportunity and wish to be considered, please forward an up-to-date version of your CV, and someone from Digital Waffle will contact you back within 48 hours if we feel you fit the criteria.

Title: Data Governance Analyst
Description:
Data Governance Analyst - Edinburgh

MUST HAVE FINANCIAL SERVICES




My client, a market leading asset manager, are looking to hire a Data Governance Analyst to support the creation and implementation of a new data governance framework.




This opportunity is perfect for someone with 2-3 years minimum data governance experience who is keen to work in a smaller business that are serious about building their capability.




There are plenty of opportunities for internal mobility too, and you'll be working in very close proximity with the CEO, CFO, COO and other senior stakeholders.




Benefits are fantastic, including such things as private medical insurance and non-contributory pension.




You could be suitable for this opportunity if you:

Have solid data governance experience
Pride yourself on your stakeholder engagement and management - this is an opportunity to create real change across the business, but your ability to gain stakeholder buy in is incredibly important
Asset management or wider regulatory/financial services knowledge is a plus




Please send your CV ASAP for a more detailed brief and discussion about how your experience aligns.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Newry

​​​​​​​




Join a dynamic company in a fast-paced, digital-first environment! They’re looking for a Data Analyst who is passionate about continuous improvement and business strategy. This role goes beyond crunching numbers—expect to work cross-departmentally to streamline and automate processes, using data to drive smart decisions.




What You’ll Do:




Collaborate with the Data Engineer to support all departments
Build and maintain user-friendly reports via Power BI
Improve processes and project manage departmental improvements
Automate data using Excel, Google Sheets, VBA, and Google Apps Script




What You Bring:




Degree in Computing, IT, or 1+ year experience in Data Analysis
Strategic thinking with a business-wide impact
Strong communication skills across all levels of the company
A bias toward action—taking calculated risks and making quick decisions




Perks:




Competitive salary (£30,000–£35,000)
Growth opportunities in a rapidly expanding company
Flexible work culture, employee discounts, onsite perks







Interested?







Get in touch for full info - submit your CV, or contact Carol Donnelly on carol.donnelly@search5point0.com for full information.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About the role




We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join our team. This role will focus on developing and managing our reporting functionality, utilising tools such as Power BI. You will also be responsible for handling various data feeds and general business intelligence tasks. This is a newly created role and you will have the opportunity to lead and shape a new function within Turley, identifying opportunities to add value to the business and influence decision-making.




Key Responsibilities:




• Develop Power BI dashboards for the business to optimise its performance.

• Oversee and manage data feeds into our BI tools, ensuring accuracy and efficiency.

• Work with our IT team to understand the data analysis needs of the wider business.

• Guide IT team members in using BI tools and understanding data reports.

• Regularly review and optimise data processes and reporting methodologies.




About You




The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analytics, report creation, and a keen eye for detail is a must. Proficiency in Power BI, including data modelling, report building, and DAX is essential as well as a strong understanding of data management and data feed integration (SQL Server & SSIS). You will have strong problem-solving skills and the ability to translate complex data into understandable reports and insights. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written are a must. You will be an energetic, self-motivated individual who enjoys working with a variety of stakeholders.




One of the things I like about Turley is the support and encouragement given to help grow and progress within the company. As a co-owned business, we are in this together and the team is amazing to work with.

Alanah Smith, IT Support




This role is mainly remote with occasional travel to one of our offices to meet with the team. During the induction period, office attendance will be required but we are flexible on which office location this will be.




Why work for Turley?




We are trusted independent advisors with restless ambition to shape a more sustainable future.

We work collaboratively with our clients to deliver places and communities that thrive. We combine professional expertise with in-depth market knowledge and deploy our services — Business Cases and Funding, Design, Economics, EIA, Expert Witness, Heritage, Townscape and Landscape, Planning, Strategic Communications, and Sustainability and ESG — individually or collectively to meet client needs in the most effective way.




We offer excellent remuneration and a flexible benefits package including medical insurance, pension, flexible working allowance, ownership dividend and performance-related bonus.

Turley operates a blended flexible working model, allowing co-owners choice, freedom, and flexibility as to where, when and how they work, balancing personal, team and client requirements. We are happy to talk about flexible working options in more detail during the recruitment process.




We are committed to ensuring people, places and the planet can thrive.




We know that actions speak louder than words. As a business, and through our client work, we strive to make a meaningful impact. This is how we are shaping a more sustainable future.




We have been CarbonNeutral® certified since 2018; achieved Bronze Carbon Literate Organisation accreditation in 2023; and are working towards B Corp status.




Driven by our purpose, we believe in using business as a force for good, including generating value for our clients and profits for our co-owners.




Our aim is to be an even more diverse, equitable and inclusive company; we celebrate difference and we're actively building more diverse teams. We welcome applications from candidates regardless of background and personal circumstances who meet the criteria set out above. We would love for you to join an organisation that enables you to thrive. If you need any assistance during the recruitment process or we can put in any adjustments to support you, please contact Turley’s People & Culture team (careers@turley.co.uk).

If you think that Turley could be right for you, please apply in confidence by following the Apply Now link below or email careers@turley.co.uk, providing your CV and a covering letter.




We welcome applications directly and would prefer not to receive CVs from recruitment agencies.




The successful candidate must have permission to work in the UK by the start of their employment.

Title: Finance and Data Analyst
Description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW




Embark on a captivating journey with Designer Parfums, a leading name in the luxury fragrance industry, with a diverse portfolio that boasts global brands like CERRUTI, PLAYBOY, GHOST, ARIANA GRANDE, JENNIFER LOPEZ, GANT, MCM, HAWAIIN TROPIC, and more. As an organization, we are fueled by creativity, innovation, and international aspirations. Here, your work transcends conventional boundaries. Join us to redefine the fragrance landscape.







JOB OVERVIEW




As the Global Brands Finance and Data Analytics Analyst, you are not just a number-cruncher; you are a strategic thinker and catalyst for commercial excellence. Your work will involve pioneering insightful commercial reporting and delivering data-driven recommendations that shape the future of our diverse fragrance portfolio. Reporting directly to the Managing Director, your analytical expertise will be pivotal in driving both financial and operational improvements across multiple brands and markets.




KEY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES




Partner with cross-functional teams to decode revenue and profitability drivers, thereby influencing business and brand strategy.
Master the intricacies of Profit & Loss statements to offer nuanced insights into income drivers and potential growth areas.
Champion data-driven decision-making and brand strategy by creating robust forecasting models that anticipate market trends.
Leverage external data sources to evaluate market performance, identifying opportunities and challenges.
Steer investment decisions by providing invaluable financial modelling and analysis, challenging assumptions where necessary.
Conduct meticulous SKU-level profit analysis to inform brand and market strategies.
Evaluate ROI on media and in-store investments, supporting the Managing Director in establishing uniform KPIs across brands.
License Reporting. Monitor and provide analytics support for License contract compliance, specifically focusing on royalty arrangements.
Contribute proactively to multi-disciplinary task forces aimed at boosting efficiency and business acumen.







QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE:




A Levels or Bachelor’s degree in Maths and/or Finance/Business/Economics
A minimum of 1+ years in commercial analytics, financial reporting, or a similar role within the finance or data analytics department
Expert in Excel and proficient in Microsoft Office Suite; SAP knowledge is a plus. Excel knowledge fluency and speed will be an important requirement for a candidate comfortable with all Excel keyboard power functions and data analytics functions
Knowledge of Profit and Loss Statement is a plus







DESIRED TRAITS




Excel whizz
Strong numerical skills and mental maths acumen to be able to identify errors/inconsistencies in data or analysis quickly
Commercial and strategic mindset
Exceptional analytical rigor
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
Commitment to detail and quality
Proactive, collaborative, and a strong advocate for positive change
Quick learner with the ability to adapt in a fast-paced environment




WHY CHOOSE DESIGNER PARFUMS?




If you're a dynamic individual who thrives on innovation and cherishes the opportunity to learn and be a change-maker in an ever-evolving industry, Designer Parfums offers you the perfect platform to showcase your talent and passion. Become a key part of our journey to captivate senses and hearts worldwide.




Global Impact: Shape global brand strategies for iconic fragrances and beauty products, making an enduring mark.

Analytical Excellence: Leverage analytical skills to uncover market trends and drive data-driven decisions.

Cultural Exchange: Collaborate with international markets

Innovation Hub: Thrive in a fast-paced environment that thrives on innovation and creativity.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst | Peterborough (once a fortnight onsite) | Utilities | £35,000 - £43,000




Peaple Talent have partnered exclusively with a leading Utilities provider, who are at the forefront of providing innovative and sustainable utility solutions. They are committed to optimizing resource management, ensuring high-quality service, and driving impactful data-driven decisions. Join the dynamic team and contribute to their mission of making utilities smarter and more efficient.




Job Description:

We are seeking a skilled and motivated Data Analyst to join the team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, with specific experience using Power BI to drive business insights and decision-making. As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in analyzing complex data sets, creating visually compelling reports, and providing actionable insights to support our strategic goals.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop reports and dashboards using Power BI.
Gather requirements, design solutions and work with stakeholders on their delivery.
Act as business partner for Data Analytics to other teams as required.
Provide regular project/progress reports and resource plans.




Experience needed:

SQL, Advanced Excel.
Advanced skills using Power BI,
Knowledge of SSRS or other BI/Reporting tools.
Organised and reliable with attention to detail.
Experience in Development of data models and warehouses.




What We Offer:

💰Salary: £35,000-£43,000

📈Opportunities for professional growth and development.

🤝A collaborative and innovative work environment.

♻️The chance to make a meaningful impact in the utilities industry.

🪙10% matched Pension
